name: AdvancedSearch
comment:
The AdvancedSearch component is meant to render a section in the Settings menu to allow the end user to easily create complex queries to send to the index. Note:

You can write custom code to add new sections in the Advanced Search modal box generated by this component by attaching a handler to the buildingAdvancedSearch event.

name: AdvancedSearch.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: AdvancedSearch.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: AdvancedSearch.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AdvancedSearch.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: AdvancedSearch.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: AdvancedSearch.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: AdvancedSearch.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AdvancedSearch.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: AdvancedSearch.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: AdvancedSearch.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: AdvancedSearch.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: AdvancedSearch.options.includeDate
comment: Specifies whether to include the built-in Date section. Default value is true.

name: AdvancedSearch.options.includeDocument
comment: Specifies whether to include the built-in Document section. Default value is true.

name: AdvancedSearch.options.includeKeywords
comment: Specifies whether to include the built-in Keywords section. Default value is true.

name: AdvancedSearch.constructor
comment: Creates a new AdvancedSearch component. Triggers the buildingAdvancedSearch event.

name: Aggregate
comment: The Aggregate component allows to display the result on an aggregate operation on the index. It hooks itself to the query to add a new IGroupByRequest, then displays the result.

name: Aggregate.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Aggregate.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Aggregate.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Aggregate.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Aggregate.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Aggregate.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Aggregate.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Aggregate.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Aggregate.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Aggregate.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Aggregate.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Aggregate.options
comment: The options for the component

name: Aggregate.options.field
comment: Specifies the field on which to do the aggregate operation. This parameter is mandatory.

name: Aggregate.options.format
comment:
Specifies how to format the value. The available formats are defined in the Globalize library (see Globalize.

The most commonly used formats are:

  • c0 - Formats the value as a currency.
  • n0 - Formats the value as an integer.
  • n2 - Formats the value as a floating point with 2 decimal digits.

Default value is c0.

name: Aggregate.options.operation
comment:
Specifies the aggregate operation to perform. The possible values are:

  • sum - Computes the sum of the computed field values.
  • average - Computes the average of the computed field values.
  • minimum - Finds the minimum value of the computed field values.
  • maximum - Finds the maximum value of the computed field values.

Default value is sum.

name: Aggregate.constructor
comment: Creates a new Aggregate component.

name: Analytics
comment:
The Analytics component can log user actions performed in the search interface and send them to a REST web service exposed through the Coveo Cloud Platform. You can use analytics data to evaluate how users are interacting with your search interface, improve relevance and produce analytics dashboards within the Coveo Cloud Platform.

See Step 7 - Usage Analytics of the Getting Started with the JavaScript Search Framework V1 tutorial for an introduction to usage analytics.

See also Logging Your Own Search Events for more advanced use cases.

name: Analytics.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Analytics.client
comment: A reference to the AnalyticsClient, which performs the heavy duty part of sending the usage analytics events to the Coveo Usage Analytics service.

name: Analytics.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Analytics.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Analytics.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Analytics.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Analytics.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Analytics.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Analytics.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Analytics.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Analytics.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Analytics.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Analytics.options
comment: Options for the component

name: Analytics.options.anonymous
comment:
Specifies whether to convert search user identities to unique hash when logging analytics data, so that analytics reviewers and managers will not be able to clearly identify which user is performing which query. When you set this option to true, the Coveo Usage Analytics service can still properly differentiate sessions made by anonymous users from sessions made by users authenticated in some way on the site containing the search page.

Default value is false.

name: Analytics.options.autoPushToGtmDataLayer
comment: Whether to automatically attempt to push Coveo usage analytics events to the Google Tag Manager data layer. See also gtmDataLayerName.

name: Analytics.options.endpoint
comment: Specifies the URL of the Usage Analytics service. You do not have to specify a value for this option, unless the location of the service you use differs from the default Coveo Cloud Usage Analytics endpoint. By deault, the value is https://platform.cloud.coveo.com/rest/ua, or https://platform-<REGION_ABBREVIATION>.cloud.coveo.com/rest/ua if you have configured your search endpoint to implement data residency outside of the United States.

name: Analytics.options.gtmDataLayerName
comment:
The name of the Google Tag Manager data layer initialized in the page. See also autoPushToGtmDataLayer.

Note: Setting this option is only useful if the GTM data layer was renamed in the page.

Default: dataLayer

name: Analytics.options.organization
comment: Specifies the organization bound to the access token. This is necessary when using an access token, because a single access token can be associated to more than one organization. Default value is undefined, and the value of this parameter will fallback to the organization used for the search endpoint.

name: Analytics.options.searchHub
comment:
Sets the Search Hub dimension on the search events. The Search Hub dimension is typically a name that refers to a specific search page. For example, you could use the CommunitySite value to refer to a search page on a public community site.

Note:

If you wish to use the search hub dimension for security reasons (e.g., to provide different query suggestions for internal and external users), you should specify the search hub when generating the search token for the end user (in safe, server-side code), rather than setting it with this option (see Search Token Authentication).

Default value is default.

name: Analytics.options.splitTestRunName
comment:
Specifies the name of the split test run that the search page is part of. You can use this dimension to perform A/B testing using different search page layouts and features inside the Coveo Query pipeline.

Default value is undefined and no split test run name is reported to the Coveo Usage Analytics service.

name: Analytics.options.splitTestRunVersion
comment:
Specifies the version name for the page when a split test run is active. When reporting on A/B testing analytics data, this value specifies the test run version name that was presented to the user.

Default value is undefined

name: Analytics.options.token
comment: Specifies the token to use to access the usage analytics endpoint. Default value is undefined, and the component uses the search token.

name: Analytics.options.user
comment: Specifies the name of the user for the usage analytics logs. Default value is undefined

name: Analytics.options.userDisplayName
comment: Specifies the user display name for the usage analytics logs. Default value is undefined

name: Analytics.constructor
comment: Creates a new Analytics component. Creates the AnalyticsClient.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions
comment:
The AnalyticsSuggestion component provides query suggestions based on the queries that a Coveo Analytics service most commonly logs. This component orders possible query suggestions by their respective number of successful item views, thus prioritizing the most relevant query suggestions. Consequently, when better options are available, this component does not suggest queries resulting in no clicks from users or requiring refinements.

The query suggestions appear in the Omnibox Component. The AnalyticsSuggestion component strongly relates to the Analytics component. While a user is typing in a query box, the AnalyticsSuggestion component allows them to see and select the most commonly used and relevant queries.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.options
comment: The options for the component

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.options.headerTitle
comment: Specifies the title of the query suggestions group in the Omnibox component. This option is not available when using the default Lightning Friendly Theme. Default value is the localized string for "Suggested Queries".

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.options.numberOfSuggestions
comment: Specifies the number of query suggestions to request and display in the Omnibox component. Default value is 5 and minimum value is 1.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.options.omniboxZIndex
comment: Specifies the z-index position at which the query suggestions render themselves in the Omnibox component. Higher values are placed first. Default value is 52 and minimum value is 0.

name: AnalyticsSuggestions.constructor
comment: Creates a new AnalyticsSuggestions component. Also binds event handlers so that when a user selects a suggestion, an omniboxFromLink usage analytics event is logged if the suggestion comes from a standalone search box, or an omniboxAnalytics usage analytics event is logged otherwise.

name: AuthenticationProvider
comment:
The AuthenticationProvider component makes it possible to execute queries with an identity that the end user can obtain using an authentication provider configured on the Coveo REST Search API (see Claims Authentication). When necessary, this component handles redirecting the browser to the address that starts the authentication process.

You can use the data-tab attribute to enable the AuthenticationProvider component only for the tabs of your search interface that require authentication (see the Tab component).

name: AuthenticationProvider.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: AuthenticationProvider.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: AuthenticationProvider.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AuthenticationProvider.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: AuthenticationProvider.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: AuthenticationProvider.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: AuthenticationProvider.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: AuthenticationProvider.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: AuthenticationProvider.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: AuthenticationProvider.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: AuthenticationProvider.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: AuthenticationProvider.options
comment: The options for the component.

name: AuthenticationProvider.options.caption
comment: Specifies the display name of the authentication provider. This is the name that you want to appear in the user interface when the end user is logging in. Default value is the name option value.

name: AuthenticationProvider.options.name
comment: Specifies the name of the authentication provider. See SAML Authentication.

name: AuthenticationProvider.options.showIFrame
comment:
If the useIFrame option is true, specifies whether to make the authentication <iframe> visible to the user (inside a popup). When the underlying authentication provider requires no user interaction (for example, when a user authenticates using Windows authentication along with SharePoint claims), setting this option to false reduces the visual impact of the authentication process.

Default value is true.

name: AuthenticationProvider.options.useIFrame
comment:
Specifies whether to use an <iframe> to host the chain of redirection that make up the authentication process. Using an <iframe> prevents leaving the search page as part of the authentication process. However, some login providers refuse to load in an <iframe>.

Default value is false.

name: AuthenticationProvider.constructor
comment: Creates a new AuthenticationProvider component.

name: Backdrop
comment:
The Backdrop component renders an image URL (either passed as a direct URL or contained in a result field) as a background image. It is useful for displaying information in front of a dynamic background image. The Backdrop component will automatically initialize components embedded within itself:

  <div class="CoveoBackdrop" data-image-field="ytthumbnailurl">
    <div class="CoveoFieldValue" data-field="somefield"></div>
  </div>

comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Backdrop.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Backdrop.componentStateModel

name: Backdrop.options.imageField
comment: Specifies the field from which the background image will be pulled. If Backdrop.options.imageUrl is specified, it will override this option.

name: Backdrop.options.imageUrl
comment: Specifies a direct URL from which the background image will be sourced. Has priority over Backdrop.options.imageField.

name: Backdrop.options.overlayColor
comment: Specifies the color that will be overlaid on top of the background image. This option needs to be declared as a CSS color. Be sure to use RGBA with an alpha value lower than 1 in order to be able to see the image behind the overlay color. Example value : "rgba(101, 123, 76, 0.5)"

name: Backdrop.options.overlayGradient
comment: Specifies whether the overlay color should be instead be rendered as a top-to-bottom gradient from Backdrop.options.overlayColor to transparent. Default value is false.

name: Backdrop.constructor
comment: Creates a new Backdrop component.

name: Badge
comment: The Badge component outputs a field value with customizable colors and an icon preceding it. This component is a result template component (see Result Templates). It extends the FieldValue component. Therefore all FieldValue options are also available for a Badge component.

The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Badge.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Badge.options
comment: The options for the component

name: Badge.options.colors
comment:
Specifies the colors for the Badge component. You must specify the colors in a JSON format similar to what follows:

{
  "values":{
    "foo":{
      "icon":"blue",
      "text":"#222"
    },
    "bar":{
      "icon":"green",
      "text":"lightgreen"
    }
  },
  "icon":"red",
  "text":"#9ab52b"
}

This format allows you to customize both the icon and text colors for each field value as well as the default values.

Colors can be specified in HTML or hexadecimal format.

name: Badge.constructor
comment: Creates a new Badge component.

name: Breadcrumb
comment:
The Breadcrumb component displays a summary of the currently active query filters. For example, when the user selects a Facet value, the breadcrumbs display this value.

The active filters are obtained by the component by firing an event in the Breadcrumb component.

All other components having an active state can react to this event by providing custom bits of HTML to display inside the breadcrumbs.

Thus, it is possible to easily extend the Breadcrumb component using custom code to display information about custom states and filters.

See BreadcrumbEvents for the list of events and parameters sent when a Breadcrumb component is populated.

comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: CardActionBar
comment:
The CardActionBar component displays an action bar at the bottom of a card result (see Result Layouts). It is a simple container for buttons or complementary information. You should place this component at the bottom of a card result template (i.e., as the last child of the surrounding coveo-result-frame div).

See Using the CardActionBar Component

comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

comment:
Whether to hide the component by default and append a visual indicator to its parent query result. If this option is set to true, the component will show itself when the user clicks its parent query result.

Default value is true.

name: CardActionBar.options.openOnMouseOver
comment:
Whether to open the CardActionBar when the cursor hovers over it. This option is only meaningful when hidden is set to true.

Default value is true.

name: CardActionBar.constructor
comment: Creates a new CardActionBar component.

name: CardOverlay
comment:
The CardOverlay component displays a button that the user can click to toggle the visibility of an overlay on top of an IQueryResult. While this component typically populates a CardActionBar component, it is actually possible to place a CardOverlay component anywhere in any result. The primary purpose of the CardOverlay component is to display additional information about a result in a format that fits well within a card result layout (see Result Layouts).

When initialized, this component creates a <div class="coveo-card-overlay"> element as the last child of its parent IQueryResult, and displays a button which toggles the visibility of the overlay.

name: CardOverlay.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: CardOverlay.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

comment: Specifies the icon to use for the overlay icon and for the button icon. The name of the icon to use should be specified in dashed case. ie: facet-expand

name: CardOverlay.options.title
comment: Specifies the string to use for the overlay title and for the button text. Setting a value for this option is required for this component to work.

name: CardOverlay.constructor

name: CategoryFacet
comment:
The CategoryFacet component is a facet that renders values in a hierarchical fashion. It determines the filter to apply depending on the current selected path of values. The path is a sequence of values that leads to a specific value in the hierarchy. It is an array listing all the parents of a file (e.g., ['c', 'folder1'] for the c:\folder1\text1.txt file).

This facet requires a field with a special format to work correctly (see Using the Category Facet Component).

name: CategoryFacet.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: CategoryFacet.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: CategoryFacet.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: CategoryFacet.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: CategoryFacet.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: CategoryFacet.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: CategoryFacet.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: CategoryFacet.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: CategoryFacet.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: CategoryFacet.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: CategoryFacet.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: CategoryFacet.options
comment: The options for the component

name: CategoryFacet.options.basePath
comment:
The path to use as the path prefix for every query. Example:

You have the following files indexed on a file system:

c:\
   folder1\
     text1.txt
   folder2\
     folder3\
       text2.txt

Setting the basePath to c would display folder1 and folder2 in the CategoryFacet, but omit c.

This options accepts an array of values. To specify a "deeper" starting path in your tree, you need to use comma-separated values.

For example, setting data-base-path="c,folder1" on the component markup would display folder3 in the CategoryFacet, but omit c and folder1.

name: CategoryFacet.options.debug
comment: Whether to activate field format debugging. This options logs messages in the console for any potential encountered issues. This option can have negative effects on performance, and should only be activated when debugging.

name: CategoryFacet.options.delimitingCharacter
comment:
The character that specifies the hierarchical dependency. Example:

If your field has the following values:

@field: c; c>folder2; c>folder2>folder3;

The delimiting character is >.

Default value is |.

name: CategoryFacet.options.dependsOn
comment: The [id](@link Facet.options.id) of another facet in which at least one value must be selected in order for the dependent category facet to be visible. Default: undefined and the category facet does not depend on any other facet to be displayed.

name: CategoryFacet.options.dependsOnCondition
comment:
A function that verifies whether the current state of the dependsOn facet allows the dependent facet to be displayed. If specified, the function receives a reference to the resolved dependsOn facet component instance as an argument, and must return a boolean. The function's argument should typically be treated as read-only.

By default, the dependent facet is displayed whenever one or more values are selected in its dependsOn facet.

name: CategoryFacet.options.displaySearchButton
comment: Whether to display the facet search widget as a button instead of a search bar.

name: CategoryFacet.options.displaySearchOnTop
comment: Whether to display the facet search widget above the facet values instead of below them.

name: CategoryFacet.options.enableFacetSearch
comment:
Whether to display a search box at the bottom of the facet for searching among the available facet field values. See also the facetSearchDelay, and numberOfResultsInFacetSearch options.

Default value is true.

name: CategoryFacet.options.enableMoreLess
comment:
Whether to enable the More and Less buttons in the Facet. See also the pageSize option.

Default value is true.

name: CategoryFacet.options.facetSearchDelay
comment:
If the enableFacetSearch option is true, specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before sending a search request to the server when the user starts typing in the category facet search box. Specifying a smaller value makes results appear faster. However, chances of having to cancel many requests sent to the server increase as the user keeps on typing new characters.

Default value is 100. Minimum value is 0.

name: CategoryFacet.options.field
comment:
The index field whose values the facet should use. The field values should have the form: the; the|path; the|path|to; the|path|to|given; the|path|to|given|item; where the delimiting character is |. This default delimiting character can be changed using the delimitingCharacter option. To help you verify whether your fields are setup correctly, see the CategoryFacet.options.debug option and the CategoryFacet.debugValue method.

See Using the Category Facet Component.

name: CategoryFacet.options.id
comment:
A unique identifier for the facet. Among other things, this identifier serves the purpose of saving the facet state in the URL hash. If you have two facets with the same field on the same page, you should specify an id value for at least one of those two facets. This id must be unique among the facets.

Default value is the field option value.

name: CategoryFacet.options.injectionDepth
comment:
The injection depth to use. The injection depth determines how many results to scan in the index to ensure that the category facet lists all potential facet values. Increasing this value enhances the accuracy of the listed values at the cost of performance.

Default value is 1000. Minimum value is 0.

name: CategoryFacet.options.maximumDepth
comment: The maximum number of levels to traverse in the hierarchy. This option does not count the length of the base path. The depth depends on what is shown in the interface. Default value is Number.MAX_VALUE.

name: CategoryFacet.options.numberOfResultsInFacetSearch
comment: If the enableFacetSearch option is true, specifies the number of values to display in the facet search results popup. Default value is 15. Minimum value is 1.

name: CategoryFacet.options.numberOfValues
comment: The maximum number of field values to display by default in the facet before the user clicks the arrow to show more. See also the enableMoreLess option.

name: CategoryFacet.options.pageSize
comment: If the enableMoreLess option is true, specifies the number of additional results to fetch when clicking the More button. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

name: CategoryFacet.options.title
comment: The title to display at the top of the facet. Default value is the localized string for NoTitle.

name: CategoryFacet.options.valueCaption
comment:
Specifies a JSON object describing a mapping of facet values to their desired captions. See Normalizing Facet Value Captions. Note: If this option is specified, the facet search box will be unavailable.

Examples:

You can set the option in the 'init' call:

var myValueCaptions = {
  "txt" : "Text files",
  "html" : "Web page",
  [ ... ]
};

Coveo.init(document.querySelector("#search"), {
  Facet : {
    valueCaption : myValueCaptions
  }
});

Or before the init call, using the 'options' top-level function:

Coveo.options(document.querySelector("#search"), {
  Facet : {
    valueCaption : myValueCaptions
  }
});

Or directly in the markup:

<!-- Ensure that the double quotes are properly handled in data-value-caption. -->
<div class='CoveoCategoryFacet' data-field='@myotherfield' data-value-caption='{"txt":"Text files","html":"Web page"}'></div>

name: CategoryFacet.constructor
comment:
Create a new Component. Resolve all IComponentBindings if not provided.
Create a new Logger for this component. Attach the component to the SearchInterface.

name: CommerceQuery
comment: This component exposes options to handle commerce-related queries.

name: CommerceQuery.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: CommerceQuery.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: CommerceQuery.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: CommerceQuery.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: CommerceQuery.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: CommerceQuery.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: CommerceQuery.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: CommerceQuery.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: CommerceQuery.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: CommerceQuery.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: CommerceQuery.usageAnalytics

name: CommerceQuery.options
comment: The options for the CommerceQuery.

name: CommerceQuery.options.listing
comment:
The listing page identifier. In a typical Coveo for Commerce solution, all listing pages should share the same searchHub/originLevel1 and be differentiated by setting this option to a unique, human-readable value.

When specified, this option sets the tab/originLevel2 parameter, as well as the listing property of the context/customData object of each query/usage analytics event originating from the listing page. This allows Coveo ML to provide relevant output for the listing page, and can also be useful for usage analytics reporting purposes.

name: CommerceQuery.constructor
comment: Creates a new CommerceQuery component.

name: DidYouMean
comment: The DidYouMean component is responsible for displaying query corrections. If this component is in the page and the query returns no result but finds a possible query correction, the component either suggests the correction or automatically triggers a new query with the suggested term.

name: DidYouMean.componentOptionsModel

comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DidYouMean.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DidYouMean.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DidYouMean.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DidYouMean.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DidYouMean.searchInterface

name: DidYouMean.ID

The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DidYouMean.usageAnalytics

name: DidYouMean.options

name: DidYouMean.options.enableAutoCorrection

name: DidYouMean.constructor

name: DistanceResources
comment:
The DistanceResources component defines a field that computes the distance according to the current position of the end user. Components relying on the current distance should be disabled until this component successfully provides a distance.

See also DistanceEvents.

name: DistanceResources.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: DistanceResources.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: DistanceResources.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DistanceResources.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DistanceResources.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DistanceResources.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DistanceResources.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DistanceResources.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DistanceResources.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: DistanceResources.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DistanceResources.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: DistanceResources.options
comment: The possible options for a DistanceResources.

name: DistanceResources.options.cancelQueryUntilPositionResolved
comment: Whether to cancel all the queries until the DistanceResources component successfully resolves a position. Default value is true

name: DistanceResources.options.disabledDistanceCssClass
comment: The CSS class for components that need to be re-enabled when the DistanceResources component successfully provides a distance. Default value is coveo-distance-disabled.

name: DistanceResources.options.distanceField
comment: Specifies the name of the field in which to store the distance value. Specifying a value for this option is required for the DistanceResources component to work.

name: DistanceResources.options.googleApiKey
comment: The API key to use to request the Google API geolocation service. If you do not specify a value for this option, the DistanceResources component does not try to request the service.

name: DistanceResources.options.latitudeField
comment:
Specifies the name of the field that contains the latitude value. Note:

The field you specify for this option must be an existing numerical field in your index (see Adding and Managing Fields. Otherwise, your query responses will contain a QueryExceptionInvalidQueryFunctionField or QueryExceptionInvalidQueryFunctionFieldType` exception, and the DistanceResources component will be unable to evaluate distances.

Specifying a value for this option is required for the DistanceResources component to work.

name: DistanceResources.options.latitudeValue
comment:
The latitude to use if no other position was provided. Note:

You must also specify a longitudeValue if you specify a latitudeValue.

name: DistanceResources.options.longitudeField
comment:
Specifies the name of the field that contains the longitude value. Note:

The field you specify for this option must be an existing numerical field in your index (see Adding and Managing Fields. Otherwise, your query responses will contain a QueryExceptionInvalidQueryFunctionField or QueryExceptionInvalidQueryFunctionFieldType` exception, and the DistanceResources component will be unable to evaluate distances.

Specifying a value for this option is required for the DistanceResources component to work.

name: DistanceResources.options.longitudeValue
comment:
The longitude to use if no other position was provided. Note:

You must also specify a latitudeValue if you specify a longitudeValue.

name: DistanceResources.options.triggerNewQueryOnNewPosition
comment: Whether to execute a new query when the DistanceResources component successfully provides a new position. Default value is false.

name: DistanceResources.options.unitConversionFactor
comment:
The conversion factor to apply to the base distance unit (meter). Note:

  • If you want to convert distances to kilometers, you should set the unitConversionFactor to 1000.
  • If you want to convert distance to miles, you should set the unitConversionFactor to 1610 (one mile is approximately equal to 1610 meters).

Default value is 1000.

name: DistanceResources.options.useNavigator
comment:
Whether to request the geolocation service of the web browser. If not defined, will not try to request the service.

Note:

Recent web browsers typically require a site to be in HTTPS to enable their geolocation service.

If you do not specify a value for this option, the DistanceResources component does not try to request the service.

name: DistanceResources.constructor
comment: Creates a new DistanceResources component.

name: DynamicFacet
comment:
The DynamicFacet component displays a facet of the results for the current query. A facet is a list of values for a certain field occurring in the results, ordered using a configurable criteria (e.g., number of occurrences). The list of values is obtained using an array of FacetRequest operations performed at the same time as the main query.

The DynamicFacet component allows the end-user to drill down inside a result set by restricting the result to certain field values.

This facet is more easy to use than the original Facet component. It implements additional Coveo Machine Learning (Coveo ML) features such as dynamic navigation experience (DNE).

name: DynamicFacet.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: DynamicFacet.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: DynamicFacet.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacet.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DynamicFacet.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DynamicFacet.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DynamicFacet.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacet.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DynamicFacet.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: DynamicFacet.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DynamicFacet.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: DynamicFacet.options
comment: The options for the DynamicFacet

name: DynamicFacet.options.collapsedByDefault
comment: Whether this facet should be collapsed by default.

name: DynamicFacet.options.dependsOn
comment: The id of another facet in which at least one value must be selected in order for the dependent facet to be visible. By default, the facet does not depend on any other facet to be displayed.

name: DynamicFacet.options.dependsOnCondition
comment:
A function that verifies whether the current state of the dependsOn facet allows the dependent facet to be displayed. If specified, the function receives a reference to the resolved dependsOn facet component instance as an argument, and must return a boolean. The function's argument should typically be treated as read-only.

By default, the dependent facet is displayed whenever one or more values are selected in its dependsOn facet.

name: DynamicFacet.options.enableCollapse
comment: Whether to allow the end-user to expand and collapse this facet.

name: DynamicFacet.options.enableFacetSearch
comment:
Whether to allow the end-user to search the facet values. Note: The DynamicFacetRange component does not support this option.

By default, the following behavior applies:

  • Enabled when more facet values are available.
  • Disabled when all available facet values are already displayed.

name: DynamicFacet.options.enableMoreLess
comment: Whether to enable the Show more and Show less buttons in the facet. Note: The DynamicFacetRange component does not support this option.

name: DynamicFacet.options.enableScrollToTop
comment: Whether to scroll back to the top of the page whenever the end-user interacts with the facet.

name: DynamicFacet.options.field
comment: The name of the field on which to base this facet. Must be prefixed by @, and must reference an existing field whose Facet option is enabled.

name: DynamicFacet.options.filterFacetCount
comment:
Whether to exclude folded result parents when estimating result counts for facet values. See also the Folding and FoldingForThread components.

Default: false if folded results are requested; true otherwise.

name: DynamicFacet.options.id
comment:
The unique identifier for this facet. Among other things, this is used to record and read the facet state in the URL fragment identifier (see the enableHistory SearchInterface option).

Tip: When several facets in a given search interface are based on the same field, ensure that each of those facets has a distinct id.

If specified, must contain between 1 and 60 characters. Only alphanumeric (A-Za-z0-9), underscore (_), and hyphen (-) characters are kept; other characters are automatically removed.

Defaults to the field option value.

name: DynamicFacet.options.includeInBreadcrumb
comment: Whether to notify the Breadcrumb component when toggling values in the facet. See also the numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb option.

name: DynamicFacet.options.injectionDepth
comment: The number of items to scan for facet values. Setting this option to a higher value may enhance the accuracy of facet value counts at the cost of slower query performance.

name: DynamicFacet.options.numberOfValues
comment: The number of values to request for this facet. Also determines the default maximum number of additional values to request each time this facet is expanded, and the maximum number of values to display when this facet is collapsed (see the enableCollapse option).

name: DynamicFacet.options.numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb
comment: The maximum number of selected values the Breadcrumb component can display before outputting a N more... link for the facet.

name: DynamicFacet.options.sortCriteria
comment:
The sort criterion to use for this facet. See FacetSortCriteria for the list and description of allowed values.

By default, the following behavior applies:

  • If the requested numberOfValues is greater than or equal to the currently displayed number of values, the alphanumeric criterion is used.
  • If the requested numberOfValues is less than the currently displayed number of values and the facet is not currently expanded, the score criterion is used.
  • Otherwise, the alphanumeric criterion is used.

name: DynamicFacet.options.title
comment: The title to display for this facet. Defaults to the localized string for NoTitle.

name: DynamicFacet.options.useLeadingWildcardInFacetSearch
comment: Whether to prepend facet search queries with a wildcard. Note: The DynamicFacetRange component does not support this option.

name: DynamicFacet.options.valueCaption
comment: A mapping of facet values to their desired captions. Note: The DynamicFacetRange component does not support this option.

name: DynamicFacet.constructor
comment: Creates a new DynamicFacet instance.

name: DynamicFacetManager
comment: The DynamicFacetManager component is meant to be a parent for multiple DynamicFacet & DynamicFacetRange components. This component allows controlling a set of DynamicFacet and DynamicFacetRange as a group.

name: DynamicFacetManager.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: DynamicFacetManager.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: DynamicFacetManager.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacetManager.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DynamicFacetManager.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DynamicFacetManager.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DynamicFacetManager.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacetManager.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DynamicFacetManager.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: DynamicFacetManager.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DynamicFacetManager.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: DynamicFacetManager.options
comment: The options for the DynamicFacetManager

name: DynamicFacetManager.options.compareFacets
comment:
A custom sort function to execute on facets on every successful query response @externaldocs Using Custom Dynamic Facet Sort Functions. Note:

If specified, the function must implement the JavaScript compareFunction (see Array.prototype.sort. You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

name: DynamicFacetManager.options.enableReorder
comment: Whether to allow the reordering of facets based on Coveo ML and index ranking scores. Default: true

name: DynamicFacetManager.options.maximumNumberOfExpandedFacets
comment:
The maximum number of expanded facets inside the manager. Remaining facets are collapsed. Note: Prioritizes facets with active values, and then prioritizes first facets. If the number of facets with active values exceeds the value of the maximumNumberOfExpandedFacets option, it overrides the option.

Using the value -1 disables the feature and keeps all facets expanded.

name: DynamicFacetManager.options.onUpdate
comment:
A function to execute whenever facets are updated in the query response @externaldocs Defining Custom Dynamic Facet Behaviors. Note:

You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

name: DynamicFacetManager.constructor
comment: Creates a new DynamicFacetManager instance.

name: DynamicFacetRange
comment:
A DynamicFacetRange is a facet whose values are expressed as ranges. You must set the field option to a value targeting a numeric or date field in your index for this component to work.

This component extends the DynamicFacet component and supports all DynamicFacet options except:

  • enableFacetSearch
  • useLeadingWildcardInFacetSearch
  • enableMoreLess
  • valueCaption
  • sortCriteria

name: DynamicFacetRange.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: DynamicFacetRange.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: DynamicFacetRange.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacetRange.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DynamicFacetRange.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DynamicFacetRange.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DynamicFacetRange.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicFacetRange.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DynamicFacetRange.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: DynamicFacetRange.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DynamicFacetRange.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: DynamicFacetRange.options
comment: The options for the DynamicFacetRange

name: DynamicFacetRange.options.currencySymbol
comment: The currency symbol to use if the valueFormat is currency. By default, the component uses the currency associated with the currently loaded culture file (see Changing the Language of Your Search Interface).

name: DynamicFacetRange.options.ranges
comment:
The list of range values to request (see Requesting Specific FacetRange Values). This value will override the numberOfValues value.

If this option is not defined, the index will try to generate automatic ranges.

name: DynamicFacetRange.options.valueFormat
comment:
The string format to apply to the minimum and maximum value of each range displayed in the facet. See DynamicFacetRangeValueFormat for the list and description of allowed formats.

Default: If the field contains "date", the format will be date. Else, it will be number.

name: DynamicFacetRange.options.valueSeparator
comment: The label to insert between the minimum and maximum value of each range displayed in the facet. Default: The localized string for to.

name: DynamicFacetRange.constructor
comment: Creates a new DynamicFacetRange instance.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet
comment: The DynamicHierarchicalFacet component is a facet that renders values in a hierarchical fashion. It determines the filter to apply depending on the selected path of values. This facet requires a field with a special format to work correctly.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options
comment: The options for the DynamicHierarchicalFacet

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.basePath
comment:
The base path shared by all values to display in the hierarchical facet. If you set this option, the specified base path will always be active on the facet.

This implies that:

  • The end user will not have to manually select the specified base path values.
  • Values that do not have the specified base path will not be displayed in the facet.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.clearLabel
comment: The label to display to clear the facet when a value is selected. Default value is the localized string for AllCategories.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.collapsedByDefault
comment: Whether this facet should be collapsed by default.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.delimitingCharacter
comment:
The character that specifies the hierarchical dependency. Example:

If your field has the following values:

electronics; electronics>laptops; electronics>laptops>gaming;

The delimiting character is >.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.dependsOn
comment: The id option value of another facet in which at least one value must be selected in order for the dependent hierarchical facet to be visible. Default: undefined and the hierarchical facet does not depend on any other facet to be displayed.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.dependsOnCondition
comment:
A function that verifies whether the current state of the dependsOn facet allows the dependent facet to be displayed. If specified, the function receives a reference to the resolved dependsOn facet component instance as an argument, and must return a boolean. The function's argument should typically be treated as read-only.

By default, the dependent facet is displayed whenever one or more values are selected in its dependsOn facet.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.enableCollapse
comment: Whether to allow the end-user to expand and collapse this facet.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.enableFacetSearch
comment: Whether to allow the end-user to search the facet values.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.enableMoreLess
comment: Whether to enable the More and Less buttons in the Facet. See also the numberOfValues option.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.enableScrollToTop
comment: Whether to scroll back to the top of the page whenever the end-user interacts with a facet.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.field
comment: The index field whose values the facet should use. The field values should have the form: the; the|path; the|path|to; the|path|to|given; the|path|to|given|item; where the delimiting character is |. This default delimiting character can be changed using the delimitingCharacter option. To help you verify whether your fields are setup correctly, use the debugInfo method.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.filterFacetCount
comment:
Whether to exclude folded result parents when estimating result counts for facet values. See also the Folding and FoldingForThread components.

Default: false if folded results are requested; true otherwise.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.id
comment:
A unique identifier for the facet. Among other things, this identifier serves the purpose of saving the facet state in the URL hash. If you have two facets with the same field on the same page, you should specify an id value for at least one of those two facets. This id must be unique among the facets.

Default value is the field option value.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.includeInBreadcrumb
comment: Whether to notify the Breadcrumb component when toggling values in the facet.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.injectionDepth
comment: The number of items to scan for facet values. Setting this option to a higher value may enhance the accuracy of facet value counts at the cost of slower query performance.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.numberOfValues
comment: The maximum number of field values to display by default in the facet before the user clicks the arrow to show more. See also the enableMoreLess option.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.sortCriteria
comment: The sort criterion to use for this facet. Default (Search API): occurrences.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.title
comment: The title to display at the top of the facet. Default value is the localized string for NoTitle.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.options.valueCaption
comment: A mapping of facet values to their desired captions.

name: DynamicHierarchicalFacet.constructor
comment:
Create a new Component. Resolve all IComponentBindings if not provided.
Create a new Logger for this component. Attach the component to the SearchInterface.

name: ErrorReport
comment: The ErrorReport component takes care of handling fatal error when doing a query on the index / Search API. For example, the ErrorReport component displays a message when the service responds with a 401 or 503 error. This component also renders a small text area with the JSON content of the error response, for debugging purposes.

name: ErrorReport.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: ErrorReport.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: ErrorReport.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ErrorReport.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: ErrorReport.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: ErrorReport.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: ErrorReport.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ErrorReport.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: ErrorReport.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: ErrorReport.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: ErrorReport.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: ErrorReport.options
comment: The options for the component

name: ErrorReport.options.showDetailedError
comment: Specifies whether to display a detailed error message as a JSON in a text content area. Default value is true.

name: ErrorReport.constructor
comment: Creates a new ErrorReport component.

name: Excerpt
comment: The Excerpt component renders an excerpt of its associated result and highlights the keywords from the query using the appropriate template helpers. This component is a result template component (see Result Templates).

name: Excerpt.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Excerpt.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Excerpt.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Excerpt.disabled

name: Excerpt.logger

The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: ExportToExcel
comment: The ExportToExcel component renders an item in the Settings menu to allow the end user to export the current search results to the Microsoft Excel format (.xlsx).

name: ExportToExcel.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: ExportToExcel.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: ExportToExcel.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ExportToExcel.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: ExportToExcel.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: ExportToExcel.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: ExportToExcel.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ExportToExcel.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: ExportToExcel.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: ExportToExcel.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: ExportToExcel.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: ExportToExcel.options
comment: The options for the ExportToExcel

name: ExportToExcel.options.fieldsToInclude
comment:
Specifies the fields to include in the CSV output. Note that this does not affect top level properties such as the title, clickUri, printableUri and sysUri, for example.

Default value is undefined, meaning all fields will be exported.

name: ExportToExcel.options.numberOfResults
comment:
Specifies the number of results to include in the resulting Excel file. Generating and downloading the Excel file should take a reasonably short amount of time when using the default value. However, this amount of time will increase exponentially as you set the value higher.

Consequently, you should avoid setting this value above the default index limit of 1000 search results.

Default value is 100. Minimum value is 1.

name: ExportToExcel.constructor
comment: Creates a new ExportToExcel component.

name: Facet
comment:
The Facet component displays a facet of the results for the current query. A facet is a list of values for a certain field occurring in the results, ordered using a configurable criteria (e.g., number of occurrences). The list of values is obtained using a GroupByRequest operation performed at the same time as the main query.

The Facet component allows the end user to drill down inside a result set by restricting the result to certain field values. It also allows filtering out values from the facet itself, and can provide a search box to look for specific values inside larger sets.

This is probably the most complex component in the Coveo JavaScript Search Framework and as such, it allows for many configuration options.

See also the FacetRange and TimespanFacet components (which extend this component), and the FacetSlider and CategoryFacet components (which do not extend this component, but are very similar).

name: Facet.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Facet.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Facet.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Facet.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Facet.facetSearch
comment: Renders and handles the facet Search part of the component.

name: Facet.facetSettings
comment: Renders and handles the facet Settings part of the component

name: Facet.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Facet.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Facet.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Facet.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Facet.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Facet.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Facet.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Facet.options
comment: The possible options for a facet

name: Facet.options.additionalFilter
comment: Specifies an additional query expression (query override) to add to each GroupByRequest that this facet performs. Example: @date>=2014/01/01

name: Facet.options.allowedValues
comment:
Specifies an explicit list of allowedValues in the GroupByRequest. If you specify a list of values for this option, the facet uses only these values (if they are available in the current result set).

Example:

The following facet only uses the Contact, Account, and File values of the @objecttype field. Even if the current result set contains other @objecttype values, such as Message, or Product, the facet does not use those other values.


<div class="CoveoFacet" data-field="@objecttype" data-title="Object Type" data-tab="All" data-allowed-values="Contact,Account,File"></div>

Default value is undefined, and the facet uses all available values for its field in the current result set.

name: Facet.options.availableSorts
comment:
If the enableSettings option is true, specifies the sort criteria options to display in the facet Settings menu. Possible values are:

  • "occurrences"
  • "score"
  • "alphaascending"
  • "alphadescending"
  • "computedfieldascending"
  • "computedfielddescending"
  • "custom"

See IGroupByRequest.sortCriteria for a description of each possible value.

Notes:

  • The FacetRange component does not support this option.
  • Using value captions will disable alphabetical sorts (see the valueCaption option).

Default value is occurrences,score,alphaascending,alphadescending.

name: Facet.options.computedField
comment:
Specifies the name of a field on which to execute an aggregate operation for all distinct values of the facet field. The facet displays the result of the operation along with the number of occurrences for each value.

You can use this option to compute the sum of a field (like a money amount) for each listed facet value.

Works in conjunction with the computedFieldOperation, computedFieldFormat, and computedFieldCaption options.

name: Facet.options.computedFieldCaption
comment:
Specifies what the caption of the computedField should be in the facet Settings menu for sorting. For example, setting this option to "Money" will display "Money Ascending" for computed field ascending.

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is the localized string for ComputedField.

name: Facet.options.computedFieldFormat
comment:
Specifies how to format the values resulting from a computedFieldOperation. The Globalize library defines all available formats (see Globalize).

The most commonly used formats are:

  • c0 - Formats the value as a currency.
  • n0 - Formats the value as an integer.
  • n2 - Formats the value as a floating point with 2 decimal digits.

Default value is "c0".

name: Facet.options.computedFieldOperation
comment:
Specifies the type of aggregate operation to perform on the computedField. The possible values are:

  • sum - Computes the sum of the computed field values.
  • average - Computes the average of the computed field values.
  • minimum - Finds the minimum value of the computed field values.
  • maximum - Finds the maximum value of the computed field values.

Default value is sum.

name: Facet.options.customSort
comment:
Specifies a custom order by which to sort the facet values. Example:

You could use this option to specify a logical order for support tickets, such as:

<div class="CoveoFacet" data-field="@ticketstatus" data-title="Ticket Status" data-tab="All" data-custom-sort="New,Opened,Feedback,Resolved"></div>

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

name: Facet.options.dependsOn
comment:
Specifies whether this facet only appears when a value is selected in its "parent" facet. To specify the parent facet, use its id.

Remember that by default, a facet id value is the same as its field option value.

Examples:

First case: the "parent" facet has no custom id:

<!-- "Parent" Facet: -->
<div class='CoveoFacet' data-field='@myfield' data-title='My Parent Facet'></div>

<!-- The "dependent" Facet must refer to the default `id` of its "parent" Facet, which is the name of its field. -->
<div class='CoveoFacet' data-field='@myotherfield' data-title='My Dependent Facet' data-depends-on='@myfield'></div>

Second case: the "parent" facet has a custom id:

<!-- "Parent" Facet: -->
<div class='CoveoFacet' data-field='@myfield' data-title='My Parent Facet' data-id='myParentCustomId'></div>

<!-- The "dependent" Facet must refer to the custom `id` of its "parent" Facet, which is 'myParentCustomId'. -->
<div class='CoveoFacet' data-field='@myotherfield' data-title='My Dependent Facet' data-depends-on='myParentCustomId'></div>

Default value is undefined

name: Facet.options.dependsOnCondition
comment:
A function that verifies whether the current state of the dependsOn facet allows the dependent facet to be displayed. If specified, the function receives a reference to the resolved dependsOn facet component instance as an argument, and must return a boolean. The function's argument should typically be treated as read-only.

By default, the dependent facet is displayed whenever one or more values are selected in its dependsOn facet.

name: Facet.options.enableCollapse
comment:
If the enableSettings option is true, specifies whether the Collapse \ Expand menu option is available in the facet Settings menu. Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.enableFacetSearch
comment:
Specifies whether to display a search box at the bottom of the facet for searching among the available facet field values. See also the facetSearchDelay, facetSearchIgnoreAccents, and numberOfValuesInFacetSearch options.

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.enableMoreLess
comment:
Specifies whether to enable the More and Less buttons in the Facet. See also the pageSize option.

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.enableSettings
comment:
Specifies whether to display the facet Settings menu. See also the enableSettingsFacetState, availableSorts, and enableCollapse options.

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.enableSettingsFacetState
comment:
If the enableSettings option is true, specifies whether the Save state menu option is available in the facet Settings menu. Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is false.

name: Facet.options.enableTogglingOperator
comment:
Specifies whether to allow the user to toggle between the OR and AND modes in the facet. Setting this option to true displays an icon in the top right corner of the facet. The user can click this icon to toggle between between the two modes.

Default value is false.

name: Facet.options.facetSearchDelay
comment:
If the enableFacetSearch option is true, specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before sending a search request to the server when the user starts typing in the facet search box. Specifying a smaller value makes results appear faster. However, chances of having to cancel many requests sent to the server increase as the user keeps on typing new characters.

Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is 100. Minimum value is 0.

name: Facet.options.facetSearchIgnoreAccents
comment:
If the enableFacetSearch option is true, specifies whether to ignore accents in the facet search box. Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is false.

name: Facet.options.field
comment:
Specifies the index field whose values the facet should use. This requires the given field to be configured correctly in the index as a Facet field (see Add or Edit Fields).

Specifying a value for this option is required for the Facet component to work.

name: Facet.options.id
comment:
Specifies a unique identifier for the facet. Among other things, this identifier serves the purpose of saving the facet state in the URL hash. If you have two facets with the same field on the same page, you should specify an id value for at least one of those two facets. This id must be unique among the facets.

Non-word characters except - @ $ _ . + ! * ' ( ) , , ( ^a-zA-Z0-9-@$_.+!*'(),,]+ ) are automatically removed from the id value.

Default value is the field option value.

name: Facet.options.includeInBreadcrumb
comment:
Specifies whether the facet should push data to the Breadcrumb component. See also the numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb option.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.includeInOmnibox
comment:
Specifies whether the Facet should push data to the Omnibox component. See also Facet.options.numberOfValuesInOmnibox.

Default value is false.

name: Facet.options.injectionDepth
comment:
Specifies the injection depth to use for the GroupByRequest operation. The injection depth determines how many results to scan in the index to ensure that the facet lists all potential facet values. Increasing this value enhances the accuracy of the listed values at the cost of performance.

Default value is 1000. Minimum value is 0.

name: Facet.options.isMultiValueField
comment: Specifies whether the facet field is configured in the index as a multi-value field (semicolon separated values such as abc;def;ghi). Default value is false.

name: Facet.options.lookupField
comment: Specifies the field whose values the Facet should display.

name: Facet.options.numberOfValues
comment: Specifies the maximum number of field values to display by default in the facet before the user clicks the arrow to show more. See also the enableMoreLess option.

name: Facet.options.numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb
comment: If the includeInBreadcrumb option is true, specifies the maximum number of values that the facet should display in the Breadcrumb before outputting a more... button. Default value is 5 on a desktop computer and 3 on a mobile device. Minimum value is 0.

name: Facet.options.numberOfValuesInFacetSearch
comment:
If the enableFacetSearch option is true, specifies the number of v alues to display in the facet search results popup. Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is 15. Minimum value is 1.
