name: Facet.options.numberOfValuesInOmnibox
comment: When Facet.options.includeInOmnibox is true, specifies the number of values to populate the Breadcrumb with. Default value is 5 on desktop computer and 3 on a mobile device. Minimum value is 0.

name: Facet.options.paddingContainer
comment:
Specifies the parent container of the facets. Used by the preservePosition option.

Default value is element.parentElement.

name: Facet.options.pageSize
comment:
If the enableMoreLess option is true, specifies the number of additional results to fetch when clicking the More button. Note:

The FacetRange component does not support this option.

Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

name: Facet.options.preservePosition
comment:
Specifies whether the facet should remain stable in its current position in the viewport while the mouse cursor is over it. Whenever the value selection changes in a facet, the search interface automatically performs a query. This new query might cause other elements in the page to resize themselves (typically, other facets above or below the one the user is interacting with).

This option is responsible for adding the <div class='coveo-topSpace'> and <div class='coveo-bottomSpace'> around the Facet container. The Facet adjusts the scroll amount of the page to ensure that it does not move relatively to the mouse when the results are updated.

In some cases, the facet also adds margins to the scrollContainer, if scrolling alone is not enough to preserve position.

See also the paddingContainer, and scrollContainer options.

Default value is true.

name: Facet.options.scrollContainer
comment:
Specifies the HTML element (through a CSS selector) whose scroll amount the facet should adjust to preserve its position when results are updated. Used by the preservePosition option.

Default value is document.body.

name: Facet.options.sortCriteria
comment:
Specifies the criteria to use to sort the facet values. See IGroupByRequest.sortCriteria for the list and description of possible values.

Default value is the first sort criteria specified in the availableSorts option, or occurrences if no sort criteria is specified.

name: Facet.options.title
comment: Specifies the title to display at the top of the facet. Default value is the localized string for NoTitle.

name: Facet.options.useAnd
comment:
Specifies whether to use the AND operator in the resulting filter when multiple values are selected in the facet. Setting this option to true means that items must have all of the selected values to match the resulting query.

Default value is false, which means that the filter uses the OR operator. Thus, by default, items must have at least one of the selected values to match the query.

name: Facet.options.useWildcardsInFacetSearch
comment:
Specifies whether wildcards are used as the allowedValuesPatternType in the groupBy for the facet search. Enabling this option returns results that end with the entered value. For example, searching for veo would match with Coveo.

Note:

If you are experiencing slow facet search and/or timeouts when this option is set to true, consider enabling the Use cache for nested queries option on your facet field in the Coveo Cloud Admninistration Console (see Add or Edit Fields).

name: Facet.options.valueCaption
comment:
Specifies a JSON object describing a mapping of facet values to their desired captions. See Normalizing Facet Value Captions. Examples:

You can set the option in the 'init' call:

var myValueCaptions = {
  "txt" : "Text files",
  "html" : "Web page",
  [ ... ]
};

Coveo.init(document.querySelector("#search"), {
  Facet : {
    valueCaption : myValueCaptions
  }
});

Or before the init call, using the 'options' top-level function:

Coveo.options(document.querySelector("#search"), {
  Facet : {
    valueCaption : myValueCaptions
  }
});

Or directly in the markup:

<!-- Ensure that the double quotes are properly handled in data-value-caption. -->
<div class='CoveoFacet' data-field='@myotherfield' data-value-caption='{"txt":"Text files","html":"Web page"}'></div>

Note:

Using value captions will disable alphabetical sorts (see the availableSorts option).

name: Facet.constructor
comment: Creates a new Facet component. Binds multiple query events as well.

name: FacetRange
comment:
A FacetRange is a facet whose values are expressed as ranges. You must set the field option to a value targeting a numeric or date field in your index for this component to work.

This component extends the Facet component and supports all Facet options except:

  • Settings menu options
    • enableSettings
    • enableSettingsFacetState
    • enableCollapse
    • availableSorts
    • customSort
    • computedFieldCaption
  • Facet Search options
    • enableFacetSearch
    • facetSearchDelay
    • facetSearchIgnoreAccents
    • numberOfValuesInFacetSearch
  • More and Less options
    • enableMoreLess
    • pageSize

name: FacetRange.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FacetRange.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FacetRange.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetRange.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FacetRange.facetSearch
comment: Renders and handles the facet Search part of the component.

name: FacetRange.facetSettings
comment: Renders and handles the facet Settings part of the component

name: FacetRange.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FacetRange.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FacetRange.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetRange.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FacetRange.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FacetRange.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FacetRange.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FacetRange.options
comment: The options for the component

name: FacetRange.options.dateField
comment:
Whether the specified field option value targets a date field in your index. This allows the component to correctly build the outgoing Group By.

Default: false.

name: FacetRange.options.ranges
comment:
The list of range values to request (see Requesting Specific FacetRange Values). By default, the index automatically generates range values.

Note:

The index cannot automatically generate range values for a FacetRange whose field option value references a dynamic field generated by a query function. In such a case, you must use the ranges option.

name: FacetRange.options.valueFormat
comment:
The format to apply to the range values. Only works for numeric values. Some of the most commonly used formats are:

  • c0: format a numeric value as currency.
  • n0: formats a numeric value as an integer.
  • n2: formats a numeric value as a floating point number with two decimal digits.

The available formats are defined in the Globalize library.

Note: This option is ignored when the valueCaption is defined.

name: FacetRange.constructor
comment: Creates a new FacetRange.

name: FacetSlider
comment:
The FacetSlider component creates a facet which contains a slider widget that allows the end user to filter results based on a range of numerical values (e.g., a date range, a price range, etc.). Note:

This component does not inherit from the Facet component. Consequently, it does not offer the same configuration options. Moreover, some of the FacetSlider options (see getSteps and valueCaption) cannot be configured as data- attributes in the markup. If you wish to configure those options, you must either do so in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

name: FacetSlider.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FacetSlider.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FacetSlider.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetSlider.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FacetSlider.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FacetSlider.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FacetSlider.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetSlider.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FacetSlider.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FacetSlider.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FacetSlider.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FacetSlider.options
comment: The component options

name: FacetSlider.options.dateField
comment: Specifies whether the field for which you are requesting a range is a date field. This allows the FacetSlider to correctly build the outgoing GroupByRequest and render itself properly. Default value is false.

name: FacetSlider.options.dateFormat
comment:
Specifies the format to use when displaying date values. See also the dateField option.

Default value is MMM dd, yyyy.

name: FacetSlider.options.displayAsPercent
comment:
Specifies the percentage caption options to use when displaying the field values. Available options are:

  • enable (data-display-as-percent-enable): boolean; specifies whether to display the caption as a percentage. Default value is false. separator (data-display-as-percent-separator): string; specifies the character(s) to use as a separator in the caption. Default value is "-".

name: FacetSlider.options.displayAsValue
comment:
Specifies the caption options to use when displaying the field values. Available options are:

  • enable (data-display-as-value-enable): boolean; specifies whether to display the caption as a value. Default value is true.
  • unitSign (data-display-as-value-unit-sign): string; specifies the unit sign for this value (e.g., $). Default value is undefined.
  • separator (data-display-as-value-separator): string; specifies the character(s) to use as a separator in the caption. Default value is "-".

name: FacetSlider.options.end
comment:
Specifies the ending boundary of the slider. Date values are rounded to the nearest year when you set the dateField option to true.

Default value is the highest available field value in the index.

name: FacetSlider.options.excludeOuterBounds
comment: Specifies whether to exclude the outer bounds of the slider in the generated query when they are not active. Default value is false.

name: FacetSlider.options.field
comment:
Specifies the index field whose values the FacetSlider should use. The field must be configured correctly as a Facet field in the index (see Adding and Managing Fields).

Specifying a value for this option is required for the FacetSlider component to work.

name: FacetSlider.options.getSteps
comment:
Specifies a function to generate the FacetSlider steps (see the steps option). This function receives the FacetSlider boundaries (see the start and end options), and must return an array of numbers (the steps). Note:

You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

Example:


var myGetStepsFunction = function(start, end) {
  var result = [];
  for (i = start; i < end; i += 2) {
    result.push(i);
  }
  return result;
}

// You can set the option in the 'init' call:
Coveo.init(document.querySelector("#search"), {
   FacetSlider: {
     getSteps: myGetStepsFunction
   }
});

// Or before the 'init' call, using the 'options' top-level function:
// Coveo.options(document.querySelector("#search"), {
//   FacetSlider : {
//     valueCaption : myGetStepsFunction
//   }
// });

name: FacetSlider.options.graph
comment:
Specifies whether to display a small graph on top of the slider. Available options are:

  • steps (data-graph-steps): number; specifies the number of steps/columns to display in your graph. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 2.

name: FacetSlider.options.id
comment:
Specifies a unique identifier for the FacetSlider. Among other things, this identifier serves the purpose of saving the facet state in the URL hash. If you have two facets with the same field in the same page, you should specify a unique id value for at least one of those two facets. This id must be unique in the page.

Default value is the field option value.

name: FacetSlider.options.queryOverride
comment:
Specifies a query to filter automatic minimum and maximum values for the slider range. This is especially useful in the case of date ranges since the index may contain values which are not set, and thus return values from the year 1400 (the earliest date from the boost C++ library).

Example:

The query override in the following markup filters out any @date value anterior to January 1st 2000.

<div class="CoveoFacetSlider" data-field="@date" data-date-field="true" data-query-override="@date>2000/01/01"></div>

name: FacetSlider.options.rangeSlider
comment: Specifies whether you want a slider with two buttons instead of a slider with a single button. By default, only one button appears in the slider.

name: FacetSlider.options.rounded
comment: Specifies the number of decimal places to round the displayed numerical values to. Default (and minimum) value is 0.

name: FacetSlider.options.start
comment:
Specifies the starting boundary of the slider. Date values are rounded to the nearest year when you set the dateField option to true.

Default value is the lowest available field value in the index.

name: FacetSlider.options.steps
comment:
Specifies the number of steps to split the slider into. For example, if your range is [ 0 , 100 ] and you specify 10 steps, then the end user can move the slider only to the values [ 0, 10, 20, 30 ... , 100 ].

For performance reasons, the maximum value for this option is 100

Default value is undefined, and the slider allows up to 100 steps. Minimum value is 2.

name: FacetSlider.options.title
comment: Specifies the title to display on top of the FacetSlider. Default value is the localized string for NoTitle.

name: FacetSlider.options.valueCaption
comment:
Specifies a function to generate the value caption for the FacetSlider. This function receives the current slider values (number[]), and must return the caption (string). Note:

You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

Example:


var myValueCaptionFunction = function(values) {
  return "From " + values[0] + " to " + values[1];
}

// You can set the option in the 'init' call:
Coveo.init(document.querySelector("#search"), {
  FacetSlider: {
    valueCaption: myValueCaptionFunction
  }
});

// Or before the 'init' call, using the 'options' top-level function:
// Coveo.options(document.querySelector("#search"), {
//   FacetSlider : {
//     valueCaption : myValueCaptionFunction
//   }
// });

name: FacetSlider.constructor
comment: Creates a new FacetSlider component. Binds multiple query events as well.

name: FacetValueSuggestions
comment: This component provides Omnibox query suggestions scoped to distinct categories based on the values of a specific field whose Facet option is enabled.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FacetValueSuggestions.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FacetValueSuggestions.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.categoryFieldDelimitingCharacter
comment: The delimiting character used for the multi-value field referenced by the field option.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.displayEstimateNumberOfResults
comment:
Whether to display an estimate of the number of results for each scoped query suggestions. Notes:

  • Setting this option to true has no effect when the templateHelper options is set.
  • When displaying scoped query suggestions for a standalone search box whose queries are redirected to a search interface enforcing other filters, the number of results will be inaccurate.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.expression
comment: An advanced query expression to add when requesting facet value suggestions. Set this option to ensure that the suggestions are properly scoped when using the component with a standalone search box. For instance, if a certain tab is automatically selected in the search interface the standalone search box is redirecting its queries to, you should set this option to that tab's expression.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.field
comment: The field on whose values the scoped query suggestions should be based.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.isCategoryField
comment:
Whether the field option references a multi-value field. Setting this option to true if appropriate will allow the corresponding CategoryFacet or DynamicHierarchicalFacet component (if present) to properly handle the filter format.

See also the categoryFieldDelimitingCharacter option.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.numberOfSuggestions
comment: The maximum number of suggestions to render in the Omnibox.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.templateHelper
comment:
The template helper function to execute when rendering each scoped query suggestion. If specified, the function must have the following signature: (row: IFacetValueSuggestionRow, omnibox: Omnibox) => string

If not specified, a default function will be used.

Note: You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it:

  • In the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call
  • Before the init call, using the [options](@link options) top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

Example:

Coveo.init(document.getElementById('search'), {
  FacetValueSuggestions: {
    templateHelper: (row, omnibox) => { return `Searching for <strong>${row.keyword}</strong> in category <em>${row.value}</em>`; }
  }
})

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.useQuerySuggestions
comment: Whether to get scoped query suggestions from the current Coveo ML query suggestions. Note: If this options is set to true the enableQuerySuggestAddon option of the Omnibox component must be set to true as well.

name: FacetValueSuggestions.options.useValueFromSearchbox
comment: Whether to get scoped query suggestions from the current user query entered in the search box. Default: true if useQuerySuggestions is false; false otherwise

name: FacetValueSuggestions.constructor
comment: Creates a new FacetValueSuggestions component.

name: FacetsMobileMode
comment:
This component lets you customize the mobile responsive behavior of facets in your search interface. Notes:

  • You can include this component anywhere under the root element of your search interface.
  • You should only include this component once in your search interface.
  • If you do not include this component in your search interface, facets will still have a default mobile responsive behavior.

name: FacetsMobileMode.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FacetsMobileMode.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FacetsMobileMode.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetsMobileMode.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FacetsMobileMode.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FacetsMobileMode.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FacetsMobileMode.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FacetsMobileMode.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FacetsMobileMode.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FacetsMobileMode.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FacetsMobileMode.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FacetsMobileMode.options.breakpoint
comment: The screen width (in number of pixels) at which facets should enter mobile responsive mode and be collapsed under a single button. Default: 800

name: FacetsMobileMode.options.displayOverlayWhileOpen
comment:
Whether to display an overlay behind the facets when the end user expands them in mobile responsive mode. By default, the following behavior applies:

  • true when isModal is false
  • false when isModal is true

name: FacetsMobileMode.options.isModal
comment: Whether to display the facets in a modal instead of a pop-up when the end user expands them in mobile responsive mode.

name: FacetsMobileMode.options.preventScrolling
comment:
Whether to disable vertical scrolling on the specified or resolved scrollContainer while facets are expanded in mobile responsive mode. By default, the following behavior applies:

  • true when isModal is true
  • false when isModal is false

name: FacetsMobileMode.options.scrollContainer
comment:
The HTML element whose vertical scrolling should be locked while facets are expanded in mobile responsive mode. By default, the component tries to detect and use the first ancestor element whose CSS overflow-y attribute is set to scroll, starting from the FacetsMobileMode's element itself. If no such element is found, the document.body element is used.

Since this heuristic is not perfect, we strongly recommend that you manually set this option by explicitly specifying the desired CSS selector.

Example: data-scroll-container-selector='#someCssSelector'

name: FacetsMobileMode.constructor
comment:
Create a new Component. Resolve all IComponentBindings if not provided.
Create a new Logger for this component. Attach the component to the SearchInterface.

name: FieldSuggestions
comment:
The FieldSuggestions component provides query suggestions based on a particular facet field. For example, you could use this component to provide auto-complete suggestions while the end user is typing the title of an item. The query suggestions provided by this component appear in the Omnibox component.

Note: Consider providing Coveo ML query suggestions rather than field suggestions, as the former yields better performance and relevance.

name: FieldSuggestions.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FieldSuggestions.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FieldSuggestions.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldSuggestions.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FieldSuggestions.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FieldSuggestions.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FieldSuggestions.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldSuggestions.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FieldSuggestions.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FieldSuggestions.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FieldSuggestions.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FieldSuggestions.options.field
comment: Specifies the facet field from which to provide suggestions. Specifying a value for this option is required for the FieldSuggestions component to work.

name: FieldSuggestions.options.headerTitle
comment: Specifies the title of the result suggestions group in the Omnibox component. If not provided, the component will simply not output any title. Default value is null.

name: FieldSuggestions.options.numberOfSuggestions
comment: Specifies the number of suggestions to render in the Omnibox. Default value is 5. Minimum value is 1.

name: FieldSuggestions.options.omniboxZIndex
comment:
Specifies the z-index position at which the suggestions render themselves in the Omnibox. When there are multiple suggestion providers, components with higher omniboxZIndex values render themselves first.

Default value is 51. Minimum value is 0.

name: FieldSuggestions.options.onSelect
comment:
Specifies the event handler function to execute when the end user selects a suggested value in the Omnibox. By default, the query box text is replaced by what the end user selected and a new query is executed. You can, however, replace this default behavior by providing a callback function to execute when the value is selected. Note:

You cannot set this option directly in the component markup as an HTML attribute. You must either set it in the init call of your search interface (see Passing Component Options in the init Call), or before the init call, using the options top-level function (see Passing Component Options Before the init Call).

Example:


var myOnSelectFunction = function(selectedValue, populateOmniboxEventArgs) {

  // Close the suggestion list when the user clicks a suggestion.
  populateOmniboxEventArgs.closeOmnibox();

  // Search for matching title results in the default endpoint.
  Coveo.SearchEndpoint.endpoints["default"].search({
    q: "@title==" + selectedValue
  }).done(function(results) {

    // If more than one result is found, select a result that matches the selected title.
    var foundResult = Coveo._.find(results.results, function(result) {
      return selectedValue == result.raw.title;
    });

    // Open the found result in the current window, or log an error.
    if (foundResult) {
      window.location = foundResult.clickUri;
    }
    else {
      new Coveo.Logger.warn("Selected suggested result '" + selectedValue + "' not found.");
    }
  });
};

// You can set the option in the 'init' call:
Coveo.init(document.querySelector("#search"), {
   FieldSuggestions : {
     onSelect : myOnSelectFunction
   }
});

// Or before the 'init' call, using the 'options' top-level function:
// Coveo.options(document.querySelector("#search"), {
//   FieldSuggestions : {
//     onSelect : myOnSelectFunction
//   }
// });

name: FieldSuggestions.options.queryOverride
comment: Specifies a query override to apply when retrieving suggestions. You can use any valid query expression (see Coveo Query Syntax Reference). Default value is the empty string, and the component applies no query override.

name: FieldSuggestions.constructor
comment: Creates a new FieldSuggestions component.

name: FieldTable
comment:
The FieldTable component displays a set of FieldValue components in a table that can optionally be expandable and minimizable. This component automatically takes care of not displaying empty field values. This component is a result template component (see Result Templates).

Example:

// This is the FieldTable component itself, which holds a list of table rows.
// Each row is a FieldValue component.
<table class='CoveoFieldTable'>
   // Items
   <tr data-field='@sysdate' data-caption='Date' data-helper='dateTime' />
   <tr data-field='@sysauthor' data-caption='Author' />
   <tr data-field='@clickuri' data-html-value='true' data-caption='URL' data-helper='anchor' data-helper-options='{text: \"<%= raw.syssource %>\" , target:\"_blank\"}'>
</table>

name: FieldTable.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FieldTable.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FieldTable.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldTable.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FieldTable.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FieldTable.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FieldTable.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldTable.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FieldTable.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FieldTable.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FieldTable.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FieldTable.options
comment: The options for the component

name: FieldTable.options.allowMinimization
comment:
Specifies whether to allow the minimization (collapsing) of the FieldTable. If you set this option to false, the component will not create the Minimize / Expand toggle links.

See also FieldTable.options.expandedTitle, FieldTable.options.minimizedTitle and FieldTable.options.minimizedByDefault.

Default value is true.

name: FieldTable.options.expandedTitle
comment: If FieldTable.options.allowMinimization is true, specifies the caption to show on the Minimize link (the link that appears when the FieldTable is expanded). Default value is "Details".

name: FieldTable.options.minimizedByDefault
comment: If FieldTable.options.allowMinimization is true, specifies whether to minimize the table by default. Default value is undefined, and the FieldTable will collapse by default if the result it is associated with has a non-empty excerpt.

name: FieldTable.options.minimizedTitle
comment: If FieldTable.options.allowMinimization is true, specifies the caption to show on the Expand link (the link that appears when the FieldTable is minimized). Default value is "Details".

name: FieldTable.constructor
comment: Creates a new FieldTable.

name: FieldValue
comment:
The FieldValue component displays the value of a field associated to its parent search result. It is normally usable within a FieldTable. This component is a result template component (see Result Templates).

A common use of this component is to display a specific field value which also happens to be an existing Facet.options.field. When the user clicks on the FieldValue component, it activates the corresponding Facet.

name: FieldValue.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FieldValue.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FieldValue.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldValue.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FieldValue.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FieldValue.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FieldValue.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FieldValue.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FieldValue.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FieldValue.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FieldValue.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FieldValue.options
comment: The options for the component

name: FieldValue.options.conditions
comment:
A field-based condition that must be satisfied by the query result item for the component to be rendered. Note: This option uses a distinctive markup configuration syntax allowing multiple conditions to be expressed. Its underlying logic is the same as that of the field value conditions mechanism used by result templates.

Examples: Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is Article or Documentation.

<div class="CoveoFieldValue" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-documenttype="Article, Documentation"></div>

Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is anything but Case.

<div class="CoveoFieldValue" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-not-documenttype="Case"></div>

Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is Article, and if its @author field value is anything but Anonymous.

<div class="CoveoFieldValue" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-documenttype="Article" data-condition-field-not-author="Anonymous"></div>

Default value is undefined.

name: FieldValue.options.displaySeparator
comment:
If FieldValue.options.splitValues is true, specifies the string to use when displaying multi-value fields in the UI. The component will insert this string between each value it displays from a multi-value field.

See also FieldValue.options.separator.

Default value is ", ".

name: FieldValue.options.facet
comment:
Specifies the Facet component to toggle when the end user clicks the FieldValue. Default value is the value of FieldValue.options.field.

Note:

If the target Facet.options.id is is not the same as its Facet.options.field), you must specify this option manually in order to link to the correct Facet.

name: FieldValue.options.field
comment: Specifies the field that the FieldValue should display. Specifying a value for this parameter is required in order for the FieldValue component to work.

name: FieldValue.options.helper
comment: Specifies the helper that the FieldValue should use to display its content. While several helpers exist by default (see ICoreHelpers), it is also possible for you to create your own custom helpers (see TemplateHelpers).

name: FieldValue.options.helperOptions
comment: Specifies the options to call on the specified helper.

name: FieldValue.options.htmlValue
comment: Specifies whether the content to display is an HTML element. Default value is false.

name: FieldValue.options.separator
comment:
If FieldValue.options.splitValues is true, specifies the separator string which separates multi-value fields in the index. See FieldValue.options.displaySeparator.

Default value is ";".

name: FieldValue.options.splitValues
comment:
Specifies whether to split the FieldValue at each FieldValue.options.separator. This is useful for splitting groups using a Facet.options.field.

When this option is true, the displayed values are split by the FieldValue.options.displaySeparator.

Default value is false.

name: FieldValue.options.textCaption
comment: Specifies a caption to display before the value. Default value is undefined.

name: FieldValue.constructor
comment: Creates a new FieldValue.

name: Folding
comment:
The Folding component makes it possible to render hierarchic representations of search results sharing a common field. This component has no visual impact on its own. It simply folds certain search results so that the ResultFolding and ResultAttachments components can then nicely render them within result templates (see Result Templates).

A typical use case of the Folding component is to fold email conversations and message board threads results in a result set in order to display them in a convenient format. Messages belonging to a single conversation typically have a unique conversation ID. By indexing this ID on a field, you can use it to fold search results (see Folding Results).

Note:

There can only be one Folding component per Tab component.

name: Folding.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Folding.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Folding.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Folding.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Folding.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Folding.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Folding.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Folding.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Folding.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Folding.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Folding.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Folding.options
comment: The options for the component

name: Folding.options.child
comment:
Specifies the field that determines whether a certain result is a child of another top result. Note:

In the index, the values of the corresponding field must:

  • Contain alphanumerical characters only.
  • Contain no more than 60 characters.

Default value is @foldingchild.

name: Folding.options.childField
comment: This option is deprecated. Instead, use the Folding.options.parent option.

name: Folding.options.enableExpand
comment:
Specifies whether to add a callback function on the top result, allowing to make an additional query to load all of its child results (e.g., to load all conversations of a given thread). Concretely, the ResultFolding component uses this for its Show More link.

See also the expandExpression and maximumExpandedResults options.

Default value is true.

name: Folding.options.expandExpression
comment: If the enableExpand option is true, specifies a custom constant expression to send when querying the expanded results. Default value is undefined.

name: Folding.options.field
comment:
Specifies the name of the field on which to do the folding. Specifying a value for this option is required for this component to work.

Note:

In an Elasticsearch index, the corresponding field must be configured as a Facet field (see Add or Edit Fields). This limitation does not apply to Coveo indexes.

Default value is @foldingcollection.

name: Folding.options.getMoreResults
comment:
Specifies the function that manages the folding of all results. Default value is:

Coveo.Folding.defaultGetMoreResults = function(results) {
   // The results are flat, just do the folding.
   return Coveo.Folding.foldWithParent(results);
}

name: Folding.options.getResult
comment:
Specifies the function that manages the individual folding of each result. Default value is:

var results = result.childResults || [];
// Add the top result at the top of the list.
results.unshift(result);
// Empty childResults just to clean it.
result.childResults = [];
// Fold those results.
results = Coveo.Folding.foldWithParent(results);
// The first result is the top one.
var topResult = results.shift();
// All other results are childResults.
topResult.childResults = results;
return topResult;

You can pre-process all the result with this option in the init call of your search interface:

Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   Folding: {
     getResult: function(result) {
       result = Coveo.Folding.defaultGetResult(result);
       // Your code here
     }
   }
})

name: Folding.options.maximumExpandedResults
comment: If the enableExpand option is true, specifies the maximum number of results to load when expanding. Default value is 100. Minimum value is 1.

name: Folding.options.parent
comment:
Specifies the field that determines whether a certain result is a top result containing other child results. Note:

In the index, the values of the corresponding field must:

  • Contain alphanumerical characters only.
  • Contain no more than 60 characters.

Default value is @foldingparent.

name: Folding.options.parentField
comment: This option is deprecated. Instead, use the Folding.options.child option.

name: Folding.options.range
comment:
Specifies the maximum number of child results to fold. Example:

For an email thread with a total of 20 messages, using the default value of 2 means that the component loads up to a maximum of 2 child messages under the original message, unless the end user expands the entire conversation using the Show More link (see the enableExpand option).

Default value is 2. Minimum value is 0.

name: Folding.options.rearrange
comment:
Specifies the sort criteria to apply to the top result and its child results (e.g., date ascending, @myfield descending, etc.). See sortCriteria. This option works from the results returned by the index. This means that if only the three most relevant folded results are returned by the index and you choose to rearrange the folded results by date, then the three most relevant results will be rearranged by date, meaning that the first folded result is not necessarily the oldest or newest item.

However, since clicking on the Show More button triggers a new query, you would receive new results based on the sort criteria of this option.

Example

If you are folding email results by conversation and you specify date descending as the rearrange value of the Folding component, the component re-arranges email conversations so that the newest email is always the top result. Specifying date ascending instead always makes the original email the top result, as it is also necessarily the oldest.

By default, the component displays the results in the order that the index returns them.

name: Folding.options.options
comment: The options for the component

name: Folding.options.options.child
comment:
Specifies the field that determines whether a certain result is a child of another top result. Note:

In the index, the values of the corresponding field must:

  • Contain alphanumerical characters only.
  • Contain no more than 60 characters.

Default value is @foldingchild.

name: Folding.options.options.childField
comment: This option is deprecated. Instead, use the Folding.options.parent option.

name: Folding.options.options.enableExpand
comment:
Specifies whether to add a callback function on the top result, allowing to make an additional query to load all of its child results (e.g., to load all conversations of a given thread). Concretely, the ResultFolding component uses this for its Show More link.

See also the expandExpression and maximumExpandedResults options.

Default value is true.

name: Folding.options.options.expandExpression
comment: If the enableExpand option is true, specifies a custom constant expression to send when querying the expanded results. Default value is undefined.

name: Folding.options.options.field
comment:
Specifies the name of the field on which to do the folding. Specifying a value for this option is required for this component to work.

Note:

In an Elasticsearch index, the corresponding field must be configured as a Facet field (see Add or Edit Fields). This limitation does not apply to Coveo indexes.

Default value is @foldingcollection.

name: Folding.options.options.getMoreResults
comment:
Specifies the function that manages the folding of all results. Default value is:

Coveo.Folding.defaultGetMoreResults = function(results) {
   // The results are flat, just do the folding.
   return Coveo.Folding.foldWithParent(results);
}

name: Folding.options.options.getResult
comment:
Specifies the function that manages the individual folding of each result. Default value is:

var results = result.childResults || [];
// Add the top result at the top of the list.
results.unshift(result);
// Empty childResults just to clean it.
result.childResults = [];
// Fold those results.
results = Coveo.Folding.foldWithParent(results);
// The first result is the top one.
var topResult = results.shift();
// All other results are childResults.
topResult.childResults = results;
return topResult;

You can pre-process all the result with this option in the init call of your search interface:

Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   Folding: {
     getResult: function(result) {
       result = Coveo.Folding.defaultGetResult(result);
       // Your code here
     }
   }
})

name: Folding.options.options.maximumExpandedResults
comment: If the enableExpand option is true, specifies the maximum number of results to load when expanding. Default value is 100. Minimum value is 1.

name: Folding.options.options.parent
comment:
Specifies the field that determines whether a certain result is a top result containing other child results. Note:

In the index, the values of the corresponding field must:

  • Contain alphanumerical characters only.
  • Contain no more than 60 characters.

Default value is @foldingparent.

name: Folding.options.options.parentField
comment: This option is deprecated. Instead, use the Folding.options.child option.

name: Folding.options.options.range
comment:
Specifies the maximum number of child results to fold. Example:

For an email thread with a total of 20 messages, using the default value of 2 means that the component loads up to a maximum of 2 child messages under the original message, unless the end user expands the entire conversation using the Show More link (see the enableExpand option).

Default value is 2. Minimum value is 0.

name: Folding.options.options.rearrange
comment:
Specifies the sort criteria to apply to the top result and its child results (e.g., date ascending, @myfield descending, etc.). See sortCriteria. This option works from the results returned by the index. This means that if only the three most relevant folded results are returned by the index and you choose to rearrange the folded results by date, then the three most relevant results will be rearranged by date, meaning that the first folded result is not necessarily the oldest or newest item.

However, since clicking on the Show More button triggers a new query, you would receive new results based on the sort criteria of this option.

Example

If you are folding email results by conversation and you specify date descending as the rearrange value of the Folding component, the component re-arranges email conversations so that the newest email is always the top result. Specifying date ascending instead always makes the original email the top result, as it is also necessarily the oldest.

By default, the component displays the results in the order that the index returns them.

name: Folding.constructor
comment: Creates a new Folding component.

name: FollowItem
comment:
The FollowItem component renders a widget that the end user can click to follow a particular item. A user following an item receives email notifications when the item changes. Note:

A SearchAlerts component must be present in the page for this component to work. It is also necessary to meet certain requirements to be able to use this component (see Deploying Search Alerts on a Coveo JS Search Page).

This component is a result template component (see Result Templates).

name: FollowItem.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: FollowItem.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: FollowItem.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FollowItem.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: FollowItem.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: FollowItem.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: FollowItem.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: FollowItem.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: FollowItem.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: FollowItem.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: FollowItem.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: FollowItem.options
comment: The options for the follow item component

name: FollowItem.options.modifiedDateField
comment: Specifies the ISubscriptionItemRequest.modifiedDateField to use when sending the ISubscriptionItemRequest. Default value is undefined.

name: FollowItem.options.watchedFields
comment: Specifies the ISubscriptionItemRequest.watchedFields to use when sending the ISubscriptionItemRequest. Default value is undefined.

name: FollowItem.constructor
comment: Creates a new FollowItem component.

name: HiddenQuery
comment: The HiddenQuery component handles a "hidden" query parameter (hq) and its description (hd). Concretely, this means that if a HiddenQuery component is present in your page and you load your search interface with hq=foo&hd=bar in the URL hash, the component adds foo as an expression to the query (hq is the hidden query) and renders bar in the Breadcrumb (hd is the hidden query description).

name: HiddenQuery.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: HiddenQuery.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: HiddenQuery.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: HiddenQuery.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: HiddenQuery.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: HiddenQuery.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: HiddenQuery.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: HiddenQuery.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: HiddenQuery.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: HiddenQuery.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: HiddenQuery.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: HiddenQuery.options
comment: Possible options for the HiddenQuery component

name: HiddenQuery.options.maximumDescriptionLength
comment:
Specifies the maximum number of characters from the hidden query description (hd) to display in the Breadcrumb. Beyond this length, the HiddenQuery component slices the rest of the description and replaces it by ....

Default value is 100. Minimum value is 0.

name: HiddenQuery.options.title
comment: Specifies the title that should appear in the Breadcrumb when the HiddenQuery populates it. Default value is the localized string f or "Additional filters:"

name: HiddenQuery.constructor
comment: Creates a new HiddenQuery component, which binds multiple events (QueryEvents.buildingQuery, BreadcrumbEvents.populateBreadcrumb and BreadcrumbEvents.clearBreadcrumb).

name: HierarchicalFacet.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: HierarchicalFacet.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: HierarchicalFacet.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: HierarchicalFacet.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: HierarchicalFacet.facetSearch
comment: Renders and handles the facet Search part of the component.

name: HierarchicalFacet.facetSettings
comment: Renders and handles the facet Settings part of the component

name: HierarchicalFacet.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: HierarchicalFacet.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: HierarchicalFacet.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: HierarchicalFacet.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: HierarchicalFacet.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: HierarchicalFacet.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: HierarchicalFacet.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: HierarchicalFacet.options
comment: The options for the component

name: HierarchicalFacet.options.delimitingCharacter
comment:
The character that allows to specify the hierarchical dependency. Example:

If your field has the following values:

@field: c; c>folder2; c>folder2>folder3;

The delimiting character is >.

Default value is |.

name: HierarchicalFacet.options.levelEnd
comment: Specifies at which level (0-based index) of the hierarchy the HierarchicalFacet should stop displaying its values. Default value is undefined, which means the HierarchicalFacet component renders all hierarchical levels. Minimum value is 0.

name: HierarchicalFacet.options.levelStart
comment:
Specifies at which level (0-based index) of the hierarchy the HierarchicalFacet should start displaying its values. Example:

If you have the following files indexed on a file system:

c:\
   folder1\
       text1.txt
   folder2\
     folder3\
       text2.txt

Setting levelStart to 1 displays folder1 and folder2 in the HierarchicalFacet, but omits c:.

Default (and minimum) value is 0.

name: HierarchicalFacet.options.marginByLevel
comment: Specifies the margin (in pixels) to display between each hierarchical level when expanding. Default value is 10.

name: HierarchicalFacet.constructor
comment: Creates a new HierarchicalFacet component.

name: Icon
comment: The Icon component outputs the corresponding icon for a given file type. The component searches for a suitable icon from those available in the Coveo JavaScript Search Framework. If the component finds no suitable icon, it instead outputs a generic icon. This component is a result template component (see Result Templates).

name: Icon.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Icon.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Icon.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Icon.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Icon.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Icon.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Icon.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Icon.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Icon.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Icon.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Icon.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Icon.options
comment: The options for the Icon

name: Icon.options.conditions
comment:
A field-based condition that must be satisfied by the query result item for the component to be rendered. Note: This option uses a distinctive markup configuration syntax allowing multiple conditions to be expressed. Its underlying logic is the same as that of the field value conditions mechanism used by result templates.

Examples: Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is Article or Documentation.

<div class="CoveoIcon" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-documenttype="Article, Documentation"></div>

Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is anything but Case.

<div class="CoveoIcon" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-not-documenttype="Case"></div>

Render the component if the query result item's @documenttype field value is Article, and if its @author field value is anything but Anonymous.

<div class="CoveoIcon" data-field="@author" data-condition-field-documenttype="Article" data-condition-field-not-author="Anonymous"></div>

Default value is undefined.

name: Icon.options.labelValue
comment: Specifies what text to display as the icon caption/label. Default value is undefined, which means that the Coveo JavaScript Search Framework determines what text the icon needs to display depending on the result file type.

name: Icon.options.small
comment: Specifies whether the Icon component should output the smaller version of the icon instead of the regular one. Default value is undefined.

name: Icon.options.value
comment: Specifies the value that the Icon component should output as its CSS class instead of the auto-selected value. Default value is undefined, which means that the Coveo JavaScript Search Framework outputs a suitable icon depending on the result file type.

name: Icon.options.withLabel
comment:
Specifies whether the Icon component should force the output icon to display its caption/label. Note:

Due to limited screen real estate, setting this option to true has no effect on icons used inside Coveo for Salesforce Insight Panels.

Default value is undefined, which means that the Coveo JavaScript Search Framework determines whether the icon needs to display a caption/label depending on the result file type.

name: Icon.constructor
comment: Creates a new Icon component.

name: ImageFieldValue
comment: This component renders an image from a URL retrieved in a given field. A typical use case of this component is to display product images in the context of commerce.

name: ImageFieldValue.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: ImageFieldValue.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: ImageFieldValue.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ImageFieldValue.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: ImageFieldValue.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: ImageFieldValue.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: ImageFieldValue.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: ImageFieldValue.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: ImageFieldValue.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: ImageFieldValue.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: ImageFieldValue.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: ImageFieldValue.options
comment: The options for the component

name: ImageFieldValue.options.field
comment: Required. The name of a field whose value is the URL of the image to display. Note: The component uses the value of this field to set the src attribute of the img HTML tag it generates.

name: ImageFieldValue.options.height
comment: The height of the image (in pixels). Note: The component uses this value to set the height attribute of the img HTML tag it generates.

name: ImageFieldValue.options.srcTemplate
comment:
A template literal from which to generate the img tag's src attribute value. This option overrides the field option value.

The template literal can reference any number of fields from the parent result. It can also reference global scope properties.

Examples:

  • The following markup generates an src value such as http://uri.com?id=itemTitle:
<a class='CoveoImageFieldValue' data-src-template='${clickUri}?id=${raw.title}'></a>
  • The following markup generates an src value such as localhost/fooBar:
<a class='CoveoImageFieldValue' data-src-template='${window.location.hostname}/{Foo.Bar}'></a>

Default value is undefined.

name: ImageFieldValue.options.width
comment: The width of the image (in pixels). Note: The component uses this value to set the width attribute of the img HTML tag it generates.

name: ImageFieldValue.constructor
comment: Creates a new ImageFieldValue.

comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Logo.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Logo.options
comment: The possible options for the component

name: Logo.options.target
comment:
Specifies how the link to the Coveo website should be opened. Valid values supported are _top, _blank, _self, _parent.

Default value is undefined, meaning standard browser behaviour for links will be respected.

name: Logo.constructor

name: Matrix
comment:
The Matrix component uses the values of two fields (row and column) to display the results of the specified computed field in a table. The user specifies the values to use for the columns. An IGroupByRequest operation performed at the same time as the main query retrieves the values to use for the rows.

In a way that is similar to the Facet component, selecting a Matrix cell allows the end user to drill down inside the results by restricting the row field and the column field to match the values of the selected cell.

name: Matrix.bind
comment: Allows the component to bind events and execute them only when it is enabled.

name: Matrix.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: Matrix.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Matrix.data
comment: Holds the data for the Matrix.

name: Matrix.disabled
comment: A disabled component will not participate in the query, or listen to ComponentEvents.

name: Matrix.logger
comment: Allows component to log in the dev console.

name: Matrix.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: Matrix.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Trigger query state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: Matrix.root
comment: A reference to the root HTMLElement (the SearchInterface).

name: Matrix.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: Matrix.selectedColumnValue
comment: The currently selected column value, or undefined if nothing is selected.

name: Matrix.selectedRowValue
comment: The currently selected row value, or undefined if nothing is selected.

name: Matrix.ID
comment:
The static ID that each component needs in order to be identified.
For example, SearchButton -> static ID: SearchButton -> className: CoveoSearchButton

name: Matrix.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: Matrix.options
comment: The possible options for the component

name: Matrix.options.cellFontSize
comment:
Specifies the font-size to use for displaying text inside the cells. This option is mainly useful to prevent a Matrix containing many columns from cropping some of its values.

However, instead of using this option to solve this kind of issue, you could also remove some of the less important columns from your Matrix or modify the CSS of your page to allow the Matrix to occupy a larger space.

Default value is ''.

name: Matrix.options.columnField
comment: Specifies the field to use for the columns. Specifying a value for this options is required for this component to work.

name: Matrix.options.columnFieldValues
comment:
Specifies the field values to use for each column. See also Matrix.options.columnLabels.

Default value is [], which means that the Matrix will not generate any column (except the Total column, if Matrix.options.enableRowTotals is true).

name: Matrix.options.columnHeader
comment: Specifies the label for the first column on the left as a description of the Matrix.options.columnField. Default value is undefined.

name: Matrix.options.columnLabels
comment: Specifies the label values to use for each column. Default value is []. The array set for this options should match the Matrix.options.columnFieldValues.

name: Matrix.options.computedField
comment: Specifies the field whose computed values you want to display in the cells. Specifying a value for this options is required for this component to work.

name: Matrix.options.computedFieldFormat
comment:
Specifies how to format the values resulting from a Matrix.options.computedFieldOperation. The Globalize library defines all available formats (see Globalize).

The most commonly used formats are:

  • c0 - Formats the value as a currency.
  • n0 - Formats the value as an integer.
  • n2 - Formats the value as a floating point with 2 decimal digits.

Default value is c0.

name: Matrix.options.computedFieldOperation
comment:
Specifies the type of aggregate operation to perform on the Matrix.options.computedField. The possible values are:

  • sum - Computes the sum of the computed field values.
  • average - Computes the average of the computed field values.
  • minimum - Finds the minimum value of the computed field values.
  • maximum - Finds the maximum value of the computed field values.

Default value is sum.

name: Matrix.options.enableColumnTotals
comment: Specifies whether to add a Total row containing the total of each column. Default value is true

name: Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview
comment:
Specifies whether to show a preview popup of cell results when hovering over a cell. See also Matrix.options.previewSortCriteria, Matrix.options.previewMaxWidth, Matrix.options.previewMinWidth, Matrix.options.previewDelay and Matrix.options.previewTemplate.

Default value is true.

name: Matrix.options.enableRowTotals
comment: Specifies whether to display a Total column containing the sum of each row. Default value is true.

name: Matrix.options.maximumNumberOfRows
comment: Specifies the maximum number of rows to display in the Matrix. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 0.

name: Matrix.options.maximumNumberOfValuesInGroupBy
comment:
Specifies the maximum number of results to include in the IGroupByRequest for the columns. This value should always be greater than the Matrix.options.maximumNumberOfRows. If it is too small, some of the results will not be displayed in the Matrix.

Default value is 100. Minimum value is 0.

name: Matrix.options.previewDelay
comment: If Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview is true, specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before sending the query to get the preview results. Default value is 500.

name: Matrix.options.previewMaxWidth
comment: If Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview is true, specifies the maximum width (in pixels) of the preview popup. Default value is 500px.

name: Matrix.options.previewMinWidth
comment: If Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview is true, specifies the minimum width (in pixels) of the preview popup. Default value is 0.

name: Matrix.options.previewSortCriteria
comment:
If Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview is true, specifies the criteria to use for sorting the results of the hover preview. The available sort criteria values are the same as those of the IQuery.

The possible values are:

  • relevancy: Uses all configured ranking weights and any specified ranking expressions to sort the results.
  • dateascending / datedescending: Sorts the results using the @date field value, which is typically the last modification date of an item in the index.
  • qre: Sorts the results using only the weights applied by ranking expressions. Using qre is much like using relevancy, except that qre does not compute automatic weights, such as weights based on keyword proximity.
  • nosort: Does not sort the results. Using nosort returns the items in an essentially random order.
  • fieldascending / fielddescending: Sorts the results using the value of a custom field.
  • fieldascending / fielddescending: Sorts the results using the value of a custom field.

See also Matrix.options.previewSortField.

Default value is FieldDescending.

name: Matrix.options.previewSortField
comment: If Matrix.options.previewSortCriteria is fieldascending or fielddescending, specifies the field to use for sorting the results of the hover preview. Default value is the value of Matrix.options.computedField.

name: Matrix.options.previewTemplate
comment:
If Matrix.options.enableHoverPreview is true, specifies the template ID or CSS selector of the template to use to render the results of the hover preview. You must use either data-template-id or data-template-selector in the markup to specify a value for this option.

Examples:

Specifying what template to use by referring to its template ID:

<div class='CoveoMatrix' data-template-id='TemplateId'></div>

Specifying what template to use by referring to its CSS selector:

<div class='CoveoMatrix' data-template-selector='.templateSelector'></div>

name: Matrix.options.rowField
comment: Specifies the field to use for the rows. Specifying a value for this options is required for this component to work.

name: Matrix.options.sortCriteria
comment:
Specifies the criteria to use for sorting the rows. See IGroupByRequest.sortCriteria for the list of possible values.

Default value is computedfielddescending.

name: Matrix.options.title
comment: Specifies the text to display at the top of the Matrix.

name: Matrix.constructor
comment: Creates a new Matrix. Also verifies whether options are valid and coherent. Binds query events.

name: MissingTerms
