name: IExtension
comment: Information about a query extension

name: IExtension.argumentNames
comment: An array of all possible arguments

name: IExtension.name
comment: The name of the extension

name: IExternalAdvancedSearchSection
comment: Describe a section populated by external code, using the AdvancedSearchEvents.buildingAdvancedSearch

name: IExternalAdvancedSearchSection.content
comment: The content to add to the external section, as an HTMLElement.

name: IExternalAdvancedSearchSection.inputs
comment: The array of inputs to populate. External code should only push inputs that match the type BaseFormTypes.

name: IExternalAdvancedSearchSection.name
comment: The name of the section.

name: IExternalAdvancedSearchSection.updateQuery
comment: An handler to execute every time a new query is launched. The handler will receive the inputs used to build the external section, as well as the queryBuilder object to allow to modify the query.

name: IFacetOptions
comment: The available global configuration options when requesting facets through the [facets]{IQuery.facets} array.

name: IFacetOptions.freezeFacetOrder
comment: Whether the facet values should be returned in their current order.

name: IFacetRequest
comment: A Search API facet request.

name: IFacetRequest.basePath
comment: The base path shared by all values for a given hierarchical facet. Default (Search API): []

name: IFacetRequest.currentValues
comment:
The values displayed by the facet in the search interface at the moment of the request. See IFacetRequestValue.

Default (Search API): []

name: IFacetRequest.delimitingCharacter
comment:
The character to use to split field values into a hierarchical sequence. Example: For a multi-value field containing the following values: c; c>folder2; c>folder2>folder3; The delimiting character is >.

Default (Search API): ;

name: IFacetRequest.facetId
comment:
The unique identifier of the facet in the search interface. Note: Must match ^[A-Za-z0-9-_]{1,60}$.

Example: author-1

name: IFacetRequest.field
comment:
Required (Search API). The name of the field on which to base the facet request. Note: Must reference an index field whose Facet option is enabled.

Example: author

name: IFacetRequest.filterByBasePath
comment:
Whether to use the basePath as a filter for the results. Note: This parameter is ignored unless the facet type is hierarchical.

Default (Search API): true

name: IFacetRequest.filterFacetCount
comment: Whether to exclude folded result parents when estimating result counts for facet values. Default (Search API): true

name: IFacetRequest.freezeCurrentValues
comment:
Whether to include the facet request's currentValues in the corresponding facet response's values array. Note: Setting this to true is useful to ensure that the facet does not move around while the end-user is interacting with it in the search interface.

Default (Search API): false

name: IFacetRequest.generateAutomaticRanges
comment:
Whether to automatically generate range values for the facet. Notes:

  • Setting this to true is only effective when type is set to dateRange or numericalRange, and the referenced field is of a corresponding type (i.e., date or numeric).
  • Automatic range generation will fail if the referenced field is dynamically generated by a query function.
  • Enabling the Use cache for numeric queries option on the referenced field will speed up automatic range generation (see Add or Edit Fields).

Default (Search API): false

name: IFacetRequest.injectionDepth
comment:
The maximum number of items to scan for facet values. Note: A high injectionDepth may negatively impact the facet request performance.

Default (Search API): 1000

name: IFacetRequest.isFieldExpanded
comment: Whether the facet is expanded in the search interface at the moment of the request. Default (Search API): false

name: IFacetRequest.numberOfValues
comment:
The maximum number of facet values to fetch. Note: If freezeCurrentValues is true, numberOfValues must be equal to the currentValues array length.

Default (Search API): 8

name: IFacetRequest.preventAutoSelect
comment: Whether to prevent Coveo ML from automatically selecting values from that facet. Default: false

name: IFacetRequest.sortCriteria
comment:
The sort criterion to apply to the returned facet values. Default behavior (Search API):

  • When isFieldExpanded is false in the facet request, and moreValuesAvailable is true in the corresponding facet response, use score.
  • Otherwise, use alphanumeric.

name: IFacetRequest.type
comment: The kind of values to request for the facet. Default (Search API): Specific

name: IFacetRequestValue
comment: A currentValues item in a Search API facet request.

name: IFacetRequestValue.children
comment: The children of this category facet value. Each child is a full-fledged category facet value that may in turn have its own children and so forth, up to a maximum depth of 50 levels

name: IFacetRequestValue.end
comment:
The value to end the range at. Examples:

  • 500
  • 2018-12-31T23:59:59.999Z

name: IFacetRequestValue.endInclusive
comment: Whether to include the end value in the range.

name: IFacetRequestValue.label
comment:
The label to associate with the range value. Examples:

  • 0 - 500
  • In 2018

name: IFacetRequestValue.preventAutoSelect
comment: Whether to prevent Coveo ML from automatically selecting the facet value. Default: false

name: IFacetRequestValue.retrieveChildren
comment: Whether to retrieve the children of this category facet value. Can only be used on leaf values in the request (i.e., values with no current children). Default: false

name: IFacetRequestValue.retrieveCount
comment: If retrieveChildren is true, the maximum number of children to retrieve for this leaf value. Default (Search API): 0

name: IFacetRequestValue.start
comment:
The value to start the range at. Examples:

  • 0
  • 2018-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

name: IFacetRequestValue.state
comment: The current facet value state in the search interface. Default (Search API): idle

name: IFacetRequestValue.value
comment: Required (Search API). The facet value name.

name: IFacetResponse
comment: An item in the response of a Search API facet request.

name: IFacetResponse.facetId
comment: The unique facet identifier in the search interface.

name: IFacetResponse.field
comment: The name of the field on which the facet is based.

name: IFacetResponse.moreValuesAvailable
comment: Whether additional values are available for the facet.

name: IFacetResponse.values
comment: The returned facet values. See IFacetResponseValue

name: IFacetResponseValue
comment: A values item in a Search API facet response.

name: IFacetResponseValue.children
comment: The children of this hierarchical facet value.

name: IFacetResponseValue.end
comment:
The value to end the range at. Examples:

  • 500
  • 2018-12-31T23:59:59.999Z

name: IFacetResponseValue.endInclusive
comment: Whether to include the end value in the range.

name: IFacetResponseValue.isLeafValue
comment: When the hierarchical value has no children, this property is true.

name: IFacetResponseValue.label
comment:
The label to associate with the range value. Examples:

  • 0 - 500
  • In 2018

name: IFacetResponseValue.moreValuesAvailable
comment: Whether additional values are available for the facet.

name: IFacetResponseValue.numberOfResults
comment: The number of query result items matching the facet value.

name: IFacetResponseValue.start
comment:
The value to start the range at. Examples:

  • 0
  • 2018-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

name: IFacetResponseValue.state
comment: The facet value state to display in the search interface.

name: IFacetResponseValue.value
comment: The facet value name.

name: IFacetSearchRequest
comment: A Search API facet search request.

name: IFacetSearchRequest.basePath
comment: The base path shared by all values for the facet. Note: This parameter has no effect unless the facet type is hierarchical.

name: IFacetSearchRequest.captions
comment:
A dictionary that maps index field values to facet value display names. Example

{"acme_productA": "ACME Product A", "acme_productB": "ACME Product B"}

name: IFacetSearchRequest.delimitingCharacter
comment:
The character to use to split field values into a hierarchical sequence. Example:

For a multi-value field containing the following values:

c; c>folder2; c>folder2>folder3;

The delimiting character is >.

For a hierarchical field containing the following values:

c;folder2;folder3;

The delimiting character is ;.

Default: ;

name: IFacetSearchRequest.field
comment: The name of the field against which to execute the facet search request.

name: IFacetSearchRequest.ignorePaths
comment: A list of paths to filter out from the hierarchical facet search results. Example: [["Electronics", "Entertainment", "Gaming Consoles"],["Appliances", "Kitchen"]]

name: IFacetSearchRequest.ignoreValues
comment: A list of index field values to filter out from the facet search results. Example: ["blue", "green"]

name: IFacetSearchRequest.numberOfValues
comment: The maximum number of facet values to fetch. Default (Search API): 10

name: IFacetSearchRequest.query
comment:
The string to match. Typically, the text entered by the end-user in the facet search box, to which one or more wildcard characters (*) may be added.

Example: "*oran*"

name: IFacetSearchRequest.searchContext
comment: The query parameters representing the current state of the search interface. See the query documentation.

name: IFacetSearchRequest.type
comment: The kind of facet values against which the search request is being made. Default: specific

name: IFacetSearchResponse
comment: A Search API facet search response.

name: IFacetSearchResponse.moreValuesAvailable
comment: Whether additional facet values matching the request are available.

name: IFacetSearchResponse.values
comment: The facet values.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow
comment: Used to define a row returned by an IFacetValueSuggestionsProvider.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow.field
comment: The field that was used for the suggestions.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow.keyword
comment: The keyword that was used in the query to retrieve results.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow.numberOfResults
comment: The number of results matching the value for the given keyword.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow.score
comment: The score computed by the suggestions provider. A higher score means the results is more relevant.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionRow.value
comment: The field value returned by the suggestion that should be used to filter the results.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionsProvider
comment: Provides suggestions for the FacetValueSuggestions component.

name: IFacetValueSuggestionsProviderOptions
comment: Defines options for the FacetValueSuggestions component.

name: IFetchMoreSuccessEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.fetchMoreSuccess

name: IFetchMoreSuccessEventArgs.query
comment: The query that was just executed

name: IFetchMoreSuccessEventArgs.queryBuilder
comment: The QueryBuilder that was used for the current query

name: IFetchMoreSuccessEventArgs.results
comment: The results returned by the query that was executed

name: IFetchMoreSuccessEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: IFieldConditionOption
comment: The IFieldConditionOption is a component option expressing a field-based condition that must be satisfied.

name: IFieldConditionOption.field
comment: The name of the field on which the condition is based (e.g., author).

name: IFieldConditionOption.reverseCondition
comment: Whether the condition should disallow the specified values rather than allowing them.

name: IFieldConditionOption.values
comment: The field values allowed (or disallowed) by the condition (e.g., ["Alice Smith", "Bob Jones"]).

name: IFieldDescription
comment: Information about a single field in the index

name: IFieldDescription.defaultValue
comment: The default value of the field

name: IFieldDescription.description
comment: A small(ish) description of the field

name: IFieldDescription.fieldSourceType
comment: It's fieldSourceType, as a string.

name: IFieldDescription.fieldType
comment:
It's fieldType, as a string.
eg: Date, Double, Integer, LargeString, Long, SmallString

name: IFieldDescription.groupByField
comment: Gets whether the field is considered groupBy (facet)

name: IFieldDescription.includeInQuery
comment: Gets whether the field can be referenced in a query.

name: IFieldDescription.includeInResults
comment: Gets whether the field is returned with results.

name: IFieldDescription.name
comment: It's name, as a string

name: IFieldDescription.sortByField
comment: Gets whether the field can be used to sort results

name: IFieldDescription.splitGroupByField
comment: Gets whether the field is considered splitGroupBy (facet with ; between values)

name: IFieldDescription.type
comment: It's type, as a string

name: IFieldOption
comment: The IFieldOption interface declares a type for options that should contain a field to be used in a query. The only constraint this type has over a basic string is that it should start with the @ character.

name: IFieldOption.String
comment: Allows manipulation and formatting of text strings and determination and location of substrings within strings.

name: IFieldOption.length
comment: Returns the length of a String object.

name: IFormWidget
comment: Describe an interface for a simple form widget. Checkbox, DatePicker, Dropdown are all examples of IFormWidgets.

name: IGeolocationPosition
comment: The IGeolocationPosition interface describes a geolocation position usable by the DistanceResources component.

name: IGeolocationPositionProvider
comment: The IGeolocationPositionProvider interface describes an object with a method that can provide a geolocation position to the DistanceResources component.

name: IGetDocumentOptions
comment: The IGetDocumentOptions interface describes the available options when calling against a SearchEndpoint to get an item.

name: IGroupByRequest
comment: The IGroupByRequest interface describes a Group By operation to perform against the index. See Group By Operations.

name: IGroupByRequest.allowedValues
comment:
Explicitly specifies a list of values for which to generate Group By values. You can use trailing wildcards to include ranges of values.

Example:

The array ["foo", "bar*"] would return Group By values for foo and any value starting with bar.

name: IGroupByRequest.allowedValuesPatternType
comment: The pattern type to use for the IGroupByRequest.allowedValues property (see AllowedValuesPatternType). This option is empty by default, which makes it behave as legacy.

name: IGroupByRequest.computedFields
comment: Specifies an array of computed fields that should be evaluated for each Group By value that is returned. Computed fields are used to perform aggregate operations on other fields for all the matching items having a specific value in the Group By field in the results. See Computed Fields.

name: IGroupByRequest.constantQueryOverride
comment:
Specifies a constant query expression on which to compute the Group By operation. This feature is similar to the queryOverride feature, except that in this case, the index keeps the constant query expression in cache for faster queries. You should avoid specifying a dynamic query expression for this parameter, for doing so will negatively impact performance.

By default, the constant part of the query expression being executed is used.

name: IGroupByRequest.field
comment: Specifies the field on which to perform the Group By request. The Group By request returns a Group By value for each distinct value of this field within the result set.

name: IGroupByRequest.generateAutomaticRanges
comment: Specifies whether to let the index calculate the ranges. Default value is false.

name: IGroupByRequest.injectionDepth
comment:
Specifies how deep the index should scan the results to identify missing Group By values. When executing a Group By operation, the index uses various heuristics to try to list all of the field values that appear in the result set. In some corner cases, certain values might be omitted (it is a classical example of a trade-off between precision and performance). Using injectionDepth forces the index to explicitly scan the field values of the top n results of the query, and ensure that the field values present in those results are included.

Consequently, specifying a high value for this parameter may negatively impact query performance.

Default value is 1000. Minimum value is 0.

name: IGroupByRequest.maximumNumberOfValues
comment: Specifies the maximum number of values that the Group By operation can return. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 0.

name: IGroupByRequest.queryOverride
comment:
Specifies a different query expression on which to compute the Group By operation. This feature is typically used for performance reasons to retrieve Group By values on separate expressions while executing a normal query in a single operation.

By default, the query expression being executed is used.

name: IGroupByRequest.rangeValues
comment: Explicitly specifies a list of range values for which Group By values should be generated.

name: IGroupByRequest.sortCriteria
comment:
Specifies how the indexer should sort the Group By values. The possible values are:

  • score: Sort by score. Score is computed from the number of occurrences of a field value, as well as from the position where results having this field value appear in the ranked result set. When using this sort criterion, a field value with 100 occurrences might appear after one with only 10 occurrences, if the occurrences of the latter tend to appear sooner in the ranked result set.
  • occurrences: Sort by number of occurrences, with values having the highest number of occurrences appearing first.
  • alphaascending / alphadescending: Sort alphabetically on the field values.
  • computedfieldascending / computedfielddescending: Sort on the values of the first computed field for each Group By value (see Computed Fields).
  • chisquare: Sort based on the relative frequency of values in the result set compared to the frequency in the entire index. This means that a value that does not appear often in the index but does appear often in the result set will tend to appear first.
  • nosort: Do not sort the Group By values. When using this sort criterion, the index returns the Group By values in a random order.

Default value is score.

name: IGroupByResult
comment: A result for a IGroupByRequest. This is typically what the Facet component will use to render themselves.

name: IGroupByResult.field
comment: The field on which the group by was performed.

name: IGroupByResult.globalComputedFieldResults
comment: Available if there was any computed field request.

name: IGroupByResult.values
comment: The differents values for this result

name: IGroupByValue
comment: Describe a single group by value, returned by a IGroupByResult

name: IGroupByValue.computedFieldResults
comment: If there was ny computed field request, the results will be available here.

name: IGroupByValue.lookupValue
comment: The lookup value if it was specified.

name: IGroupByValue.numberOfResults
comment: The number of results that match this value in the index for this particular group by request

name: IGroupByValue.score
comment: The relevance score.

name: IGroupByValue.value
comment: The string value. Think : Facet label.

name: IHighlight
comment: A highlight structure, as returned by the index. This structure can be used to do the actual highlighting job.

name: IHighlight.dataHighlightGroup
comment: The group number for the highlight. A single string can have the same term highlighted multiple times. This allows to regroup the different highlights.

name: IHighlight.dataHighlightGroupTerm
comment: The string that represent the highlight. A single string can have the same term highlighted multiple times. This allows to regroup the different highlights.

name: IHighlight.length
comment: The length of the offset.

name: IHighlight.offset
comment: The 0 based offset inside the string where the highlight should start.

name: IHighlightPhrase
comment: The data about a single phrase to highlight.

name: IHighlightTerm
comment: The data about a single term to highlight.

name: IIconOptions
comment: Available options for the Icon component.

name: IImageUtilsOptions
comment: Options for building an <img> tag.

name: IImageUtilsOptions.alt
comment: The alternative text for the image (alt attribute).

name: IImageUtilsOptions.height
comment: The height of the image

name: IImageUtilsOptions.srcTemplate
comment: The template to use for the image source

name: IImageUtilsOptions.width
comment: The width of the image

name: IIndexFieldValue
comment: Describe a field value returned by index

name: IIndexFieldValue.computedFieldResults
comment: The optional computedFieldResults, if requested in the IGroupByRequest

name: IIndexFieldValue.lookupValue
comment: The optional lookupValue, if requested in the IGroupByRequest

name: IIndexFieldValue.numberOfResults
comment: The number of results in the index which have this value

name: IIndexFieldValue.value
comment: The value

name: IInitializationEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on InitializationEvents.afterComponentsInitialization, and InitializationEvents.afterInitialization.

name: IInitializationParameters
comment: Represent the initialization parameters required to init a new component.

name: IListFieldValuesBatchRequest
comment: Describe a request to list the possible values of multiple fields.

name: IListFieldValuesBatchRequest.batch
comment: The list of fields to request.

name: IListFieldValuesRequest
comment: Describe a request to list the possible values of a field.

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.constantQueryOverride
comment: A query to execute when returning possible field values, put in cache in the index

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.field
comment: The field for which to list values

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.ignoreAccents
comment: Whether to ignore accents in the values

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.lookupField
comment: The lookup field to use

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.maximumNumberOfValues
comment: Maximum number of field values to return

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.pattern
comment: A pattern to filter out results

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.patternType
comment: The type of the pattern (eg: regex)

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.queryOverride
comment: A query to execute when returning possible field values

name: IListFieldValuesRequest.sortCriteria
comment: The sort order for the returned field.

name: INewQueryEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.newQuery

name: INewQueryEventArgs.cancel
comment: If this property is set to true by any handlers, the query will not be executed.

name: INewQueryEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: INoResultsEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.noResults

name: INoResultsEventArgs.query
comment: The query that was just executed

name: INoResultsEventArgs.queryBuilder
comment: The QueryBuilder that was used for the current query

name: INoResultsEventArgs.results
comment: The results returned by the query that was executed

name: INoResultsEventArgs.retryTheQuery
comment: If set to true by any handler, the last query will automatically be re-executed again.

name: INoResultsEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: IOmniboxDataRow
comment: The content that external code that wants to populate the omnibox need to populate.

name: IOmniboxDataRow.deferred
comment: This is a Promise object. It is used when you want to make an asynchronous call (most likely an Ajax request) to a service in order to retrieve the data that you will use to build your HTML content.

name: IOmniboxDataRow.element
comment:
This an HTMLElement that you want the Omnibox to render. It can be any valid HTML element (div, span, image, table, etc.). You can bind any event you want to this element and also add logic to handle the Omnibox (e.g. should the Omnibox close itself when clicking on your suggestion, should the Omnibox clear itself?).

This element you provide can be as complex as you want it to be (see Providing Suggestions for the Omnibox).

name: IOmniboxDataRow.zIndex
comment: This is an optional property. It is used by each component to influence their rendering order in the Omnibox. It works like a normal CSS zIndex: higher value will render at the top most level. Providing no zIndex will make your item render with a low priority.

name: IOpenQuickviewEventArgs
comment: The IOpenQuickviewEventArgs interface describes the object that all openQuickview event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IOpenQuickviewEventArgs.termsToHighlight
comment: The array of query expression terms to highlight in the quickview modal window.

name: IPlanResponse
comment: Describes the plan of execution of a search request.

name: IPlanResponse.parsedInput
comment: The query expressions that would be sent to the index once the search request has been fully processed by the query pipeline.

name: IPlanResponse.preprocessingOutput
comment: The output that would be included by the Search API in the query response once the search request has been fully processed by the query pipeline.

name: IPopulateBreadcrumbEventArgs
comment: Event triggered when populating the breadcrumb

name: IPopulateOmniboxObject
comment: The IPopulateOmniboxObject is an interface that is used by components to interact with the Omnibox and provides a framework for type-ahead suggestions.

name: IPopulateOmniboxObject.allQueryExpressions
comment: An array IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression used to describe each part of the content of the Omnibox component.

name: IPopulateOmniboxObject.completeQueryExpression
comment: A IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression object used to describe the complete content of the Querybox component.

name: IPopulateOmniboxObject.currentQueryExpression
comment: A IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression object used to describe the current active content (the current position of the cursor/caret) of the Omnibox component.

name: IPopulateOmniboxObject.cursorPosition
comment: The number representing the current position of the cursor/caret inside the Omnibox component.

name: IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression
comment: This object is a simple interface that describes the content of an omnibox query expression.

name: IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression.regex
comment: This is a regex of the content of the Omnibox with some special character escaped.

name: IPopulateOmniboxQueryExpression.word
comment: This is a simple string with the plain content of the Omnibox.

name: IPopulateOmniboxSuggestionsEventArgs
comment: The IPopulateOmniboxSuggestionsEventArgs interface describes the object that all populateOmniboxSuggestions event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IPopulateOmniboxSuggestionsEventArgs.omnibox
comment: The Omnibox component instance.

name: IPopulateOmniboxSuggestionsEventArgs.suggestions
comment: The list of resolved query completion suggestions, and/or query completion suggestion promises.

name: IPopulateSearchResultPreviewsEventArgs
comment: Executed when a Suggestion is focused and waiting for search result previews.

name: IPopulateSearchResultPreviewsEventArgs.previewsQueries
comment: The result previews query. This must be set synchronously before the event resolves. Setting this to a non-empty array will display the given search result previews.

name: IPopulateSearchResultPreviewsEventArgs.suggestion
comment: The suggestion to look up search result previews for.

name: IPositionResolvedEventArgs
comment: The IPositionResolvedEventArgs interface describes the object that all onPositionResolved event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IPositionResolvedEventArgs.position
comment: The position that was resolved.

name: IPreprocessMoreResultsEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.preprocessMoreResults

name: IPreprocessMoreResultsEventArgs.results
comment: The results returned by the query that was executed

name: IPreprocessResultsEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.preprocessResults

name: IPreprocessResultsEventArgs.query
comment: The query that was just executed

name: IPreprocessResultsEventArgs.queryBuilder
comment: The QueryBuilder that was used for the current query

name: IPreprocessResultsEventArgs.results
comment: The results returned by the query that was executed

name: IPreprocessResultsEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: IQuery
comment:
The IQuery interface describes a query that can be performed on the Coveo REST Search API. For basic usage, see the IQuery.q and IQuery.aq properties.

In a normal scenario, a query is built by the QueryBuilder class.

name: IQuery.actionsHistory
comment: The actions history represents the past actions a user made and is used by the Coveo Machine Learning service to suggest recommendations. It is generated by the page view script (https://github.com/coveo/coveo.analytics.js)

name: IQuery.allowQueriesWithoutKeywords
comment:
Specifies if the Search API should perform queries even when no keywords were entered by the end user. End user keywords are present in either the IQuery.q or IQuery.lq part of the query.

This parameter is normally controlled by SearchInterface.options.allowEmptyQuery option.

name: IQuery.aq
comment:
The advanced query expression.
This is the part of the query expression generated by code based on various rules.
eg: Selecting a facet value will cause an expression to be added to the advanced query expression.

name: IQuery.categoryFacets
comment: Specifies an array of request to retrieve facet values for the CategoryFacet component

name: IQuery.childField
comment: Specifies the childField when doing parent-child loading (See: Folding)

name: IQuery.commerce
comment: The commerce request to execute.

name: IQuery.context
comment: The context is a map of key_value that can be used in the Query pipeline in the Coveo platform.

name: IQuery.cq
comment:
The constant query expression.
This part of the expression is much alike the advanced query expression, but it is meant to hold expressions that are constant for all users of a search interface/widget.
The results of evaluating those expressions are kept in a special index cache, to avoid re-evaluating them on each query.
You must be careful to not include dynamic parts in this expression, otherwise you risk filling up the cache with useless data and this might have a negative impact on performance.
Expressions other than cq also benefit from caching in the index, but using cq allows to explicitly require that a part of the query be included in the cache.

name: IQuery.debug
comment:
Whether to include debug information from the Search API in the query response. Note:

This debug information does not include ranking information.

Setting this property to true can have an adverse effect on query performance, so it should always be left to false in a production environment.

name: IQuery.dq
comment:
The disjunction query expression.
This is the disjunctive part of the query expression that is merged with the other expression parts using an OR boolean operator.
When specified, the final expression evaluated by the index ends up being (q aq cq) OR (dq).

name: IQuery.enableCollaborativeRating
comment: Whether the index should take collaborative rating in account when ranking result. See: ResultRating

name: IQuery.enableDidYouMean
comment:
This enables the query correction feature of the index.
By activating this, the index returns an array of {link IQueryCorrection} with suggested word corrections.

name: IQuery.enableQuerySyntax
comment: Whether to enable the special query syntax such as field references for the basic query expression (parameter q). It is equivalent to a No syntax block applied to the basic query expression. If not specified, the parameter defaults to false

name: IQuery.excerptLength
comment:
Specifies the length (in number of characters) of the excerpts generated by the indexer based on the keywords present in the query.
The index includes the top most interesting sentences (in the order they appear in the item) that fit in the specified number of characters.
When not specified, the default value is 200.

name: IQuery.facetOptions
comment: The global configuration options to apply to the requests in the facets array.

name: IQuery.facets
comment: Specifies an array of request to retrieve facet values for the DynamicFacet component.

name: IQuery.fieldsToExclude
comment:
Specifies an array of fields that should be excluded from the query results.
eg: ['@foo','@bar']

name: IQuery.fieldsToInclude
comment:
Specifies an array of fields that should be returned for each result.
eg: ['@foo','@bar']

name: IQuery.filterField
comment:
Specifies a field on which Folding should be performed.
Folding is a kind of duplicate filtering where only the first result with any given value of the field is included in the result set.
It's typically used to return only one result in a conversation, for example when forum posts in a thread are indexed as separate items.

name: IQuery.filterFieldRange
comment: Number of results that should be folded, using the IQuery.filterField

name: IQuery.firstResult
comment:
This is the 0-based index of the first result to return.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to 0.

name: IQuery.format
comment: The format of a successful response. If not specified, this parameter defaults to 'json'.

name: IQuery.groupBy
comment: Specifies an array of Group By operations that can be performed on the query results to extract facets

name: IQuery.lowercaseOperators
comment: Whether to enable the support for operator in lowercase (AND OR -> and or)

name: IQuery.lq
comment:
The contextual text.
This is the contextual text part of the query. It uses the Coveo Machine Learning service to pick key keywords from the text and add them to the basic expression. This field is mainly used to pass context such a case description, long textual query or any other form of text that might help in refining the query.

name: IQuery.maximumAge
comment:
The maximum age for cached query results, in milliseconds.
If results for the exact same request (including user identities) are available in the in-memory cache, they will be used if they are not older than the specified value.
Otherwise, the query will be sent to the index.

name: IQuery.numberOfResults
comment:
This is the number of results to return, starting from IQuery.firstResult.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to 10.

name: IQuery.parentField
comment: Specifies the parentField when doing parent-child loading (See: Folding)

name: IQuery.partialMatch
comment:
Whether to enable partial matching of the basic expression keywords.
By activating this, when the basic expression contains at least IQuery.partialMatchKeywords, items containing only the number of keywords specified by IQuery.partialMatchThreshold will also match the query.
Without this option, items are required to contain all the keywords in order to match the query.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to false.

name: IQuery.partialMatchKeywords
comment:
The minimum number of keywords needed to activate partial match.
Specifies the minimum number of keywords needed for the partial match feature to activate.
If the basic expression contains less than this number of keywords, no transformation is applied on the query.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to 5.

name: IQuery.partialMatchThreshold
comment:
The threshold to use for matching items when partial match is enabled.
Specifies the minimum number of query keywords that an item must contain when partial match is enabled. This value can either be an absolute number or a percentage value based on the total number of keywords.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to 50%.

name: IQuery.pipeline
comment:
Name of the query pipeline to use.
Specifies the name of the query pipeline to use for the query. If not specified, the default value is default, which means the default query pipeline will be used.

name: IQuery.q
comment:
The basic query expression.
This is typically the query expression entered by the user in a query box.
Since this part of the query is expected to come from user input, it is processed by the Did You Mean feature.

name: IQuery.queryFunctions
comment: Specifies an array of Query Function operation that will be executed on the results.

name: IQuery.questionMark
comment:
Whether to enable question marks with wildcards.
This enables using the question mark ? character within wildcard expressions.

name: IQuery.rankingFunctions
comment: Specifies an array of Ranking Function operations that will be executed on the result

name: IQuery.recommendation
comment: This is the id of the recommendation interface that generated the query.

name: IQuery.retrieveFirstSentences
comment:
Specifies whether the first sentences of the item should be included in the results.
The retrieveFirstSentences option is typically used instead of excerpts when displaying email items, where the first sentence of the email might be of more interest than a contextually generated excerpt.

name: IQuery.searchHub
comment:
The hub value set from the Analytics component.
Used for analytics reporting in the Coveo platform

name: IQuery.sortCriteria
comment:
Specifies the sort criterion(s) to use to sort results. If not specified, this parameter defaults to Relevancy.
Possible values are :
-- relevancy : This uses all the configured ranking weights as well as any specified ranking expressions to rank results.
-- dateascending / datedescending : Sort using the value of the @date field, which is typically the last modification date of an item in the index.
-- qre : Sort using only the weights applied through ranking expressions. This is much like using Relevancy except that automatic weights based on keyword proximity etc, are not computed.
-- nosort : Do not sort the results. The order in which items are returned is essentially random.
-- @field ascending / @field descending : Sort using the value of a custom field.

name: IQuery.tab
comment: The tab value set from the Tab component.

name: IQuery.userActions
comment:
The user ID or visitor ID whose item views should be tagged in the query results (see the isUserActionView property of the IQueryResult interface). Examples:

  • asmith@example.com
  • 6318b0c6-9397-4d70-b393-cf4770fd1bab

name: IQuery.wildcards
comment:
Whether to enable wildcards on the basic expression keywords.
This enables the wildcard features of the index. Coveo Platform will expand keywords containing wildcard characters to the possible matching keywords to broaden the query.
See Using Wildcards in Queries.
If not specified, this parameter defaults to false.

name: IQueryBuilderExpression
comment: Describe the expressions part of a QueryBuilder.

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.advanced
comment: The advanced part of the expression

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.basic
comment: The basic part of the expression

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.constant
comment: The constant part of the expression

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.disjunction
comment: The disjunction part of the expression

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.full
comment: The whole expression

name: IQueryBuilderExpression.withoutConstant
comment: The full part, but without the constant.

name: IQueryCorrection
comment: Describe correction for a query

name: IQueryCorrection.correctedQuery
comment: The query once corrected

name: IQueryCorrection.wordCorrections
comment: Array of correction for each word in the query

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.queryError

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs.endpoint
comment: The endpoint on which the error happened.

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs.error
comment: The error info / message itself.

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs.query
comment: The query that was just executed

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs.queryBuilder
comment: The QueryBuilder that was used for the current query

name: IQueryErrorEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: IQueryException
comment: Describe an exception that was triggered by the index when performing the query.

name: IQueryException.code
comment: The exception code

name: IQueryFunction
comment:
Describe a query function that can be executed against the index
See: Query Functions

name: IQueryFunction.fieldName
comment: The field name on which to store the query function result when the query returns

name: IQueryFunction.function
comment: Function to execute, as a string

name: IQueryOptions
comment: Possible options when performing a query with the query controller

name: IQueryOptions.beforeExecuteQuery
comment: Specify a function that you wish to execute just before the query is executed

name: IQueryOptions.cancel
comment: Cancel the query

name: IQueryOptions.ignoreWarningSearchEvent
comment:
If the analytics component is enabled in the interface, it will look for any query executed by the query controller for which no analytics event was associated.
By setting this property to true, this will cancel this check when the query is performed

name: IQueryOptions.logInActionsHistory
comment: Whether or not to log the query in the user actions history when using the page view script: https://github.com/coveo/coveo.analytics.js. Only the 'q' part of the query will be logged. This option is useful, because it prevents the query to be logged twice when a Recommendation component is present. It also makes sure that only relevant queries are logged. For exemple, the 'empty' interface load query isn't logged.

name: IQueryOptions.origin
comment: The component from which the query originated. For example the pager will set the property to tweak it's behaviour

name: IQueryOptions.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query to execute is a search-as-you-type. This information will be passed down in the query events for component and external code to determine their behavior

name: IQueryResult
comment: The IQueryResult interface describes a single result returned by the Coveo REST Search API.

name: IQueryResult.absentTerms
comment: The query terms that are not matched by the result.

name: IQueryResult.childResults
comment: Contains the child results of the item, if parent-child loading was performed. See the Folding component.

name: IQueryResult.clickUri
comment: Contains the clickable URI of the item, which you can set on an href in your search interface. See the ResultLink component.

name: IQueryResult.excerpt
comment: Contains an excerpt of the item. Can be empty for certain types of items (e.g., images, videos, etc.). See the Excerpt component.

name: IQueryResult.flags
comment: Contains the list of flags for the item. Values are separated by a semicolon characters (;).

name: IQueryResult.hasHtmlVersion
comment: Contains a value specifying whether the item has an HTML version. See the Quickview component.

name: IQueryResult.index
comment: Contains the 0-based index value of the result, as returned by the Coveo REST Search API.

name: IQueryResult.isRecommendation
comment:
Contains a value that specifies whether the result was recommended by the Coveo Machine Learning service. See the Recommendation component.

See also Coveo Machine Learning.

name: IQueryResult.isTopResult
comment: Specifies whether the result is a Featured Result in the Coveo Query Pipeline (see Adding and Managing Query Pipeline Featured Results).

name: IQueryResult.isUserActionView
comment: Whether the result item was previously viewed by the user specified in the userActions request of the query.

name: IQueryResult.parentResult
comment: Contains the parent result of the item, if parent-child loading was performed. See the Folding component.

name: IQueryResult.printableUri
comment: Contains a printable URI (or path) to the item.

name: IQueryResult.queryUid
comment:
Contains the query UID, as returned by the Coveo REST Search API. This value is used mainly for usage analytics.

The Coveo JavaScript Search Framework adds this property client-side to each result.

name: IQueryResult.rankingInfo
comment: Contains ranking information, which the Coveo REST Search API returns along with the item when the query debug property is true.

name: IQueryResult.rating
comment:
Note:

The Coveo Cloud V2 platform does not support collaborative rating. Therefore, this property is obsolete in Coveo Cloud V2.

Contains the collaborative rating value for the item.

See the ResultRating component.

name: IQueryResult.raw
comment: Contains the raw field values of the item, expressed as key-value pairs.

name: IQueryResult.searchInterface
comment:
The SearchInterface inside which this result is rendered. This value is used mainly to allow for conditional rendering of results templates.

The Coveo JavaScript Search Framework adds this property client-side to each result.

name: IQueryResult.state
comment:
Contains the query state of the SearchInterface inside which this result is rendered. This value is used mainly to allow for conditional rendering of results templates.

The Coveo JavaScript Search Framework adds this property client-side to each result.

name: IQueryResult.title
comment: Contains the title of the item.

name: IQueryResult.uniqueId
comment: Contains the unique ID of the item. This parameter is useful when making certain calls to a SearchEndpoint.

name: IQueryResult.uri
comment: Contains the URI of the item.

name: IQueryResults
comment: Describe a set a results returned by the Search API

name: IQueryResults.advancedExpression
comment:
The advanced expression that was executed.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQueryResults.apiVersion
comment: The search api version that was used for this query.

name: IQueryResults.basicExpression
comment:
The basic expression that was executed.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQueryResults.categoryFacets
comment: Category facet results of the query

name: IQueryResults.clientDuration
comment: The duration of the query for the client.

name: IQueryResults.constantExpression
comment:
The constant expression that was executed.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQueryResults.duration
comment: The total query duration, which is the sum of the indexDuration and searchAPIDuration, including any latency incurred through the necessary network hops.

name: IQueryResults.error
comment: When an error occurs, and the errorsAsSuccess flag is passed, the error will be returned in the body of the response

name: IQueryResults.exception
comment: The exception that can be returned by the index if the query triggered an error

name: IQueryResults.executionReport
comment:
A detailed execution report sent by the Search API.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQueryResults.facets
comment: Facet results of the query

name: IQueryResults.groupByResults
comment: The group by results of the query

name: IQueryResults.indexDuration
comment: The part of the total query duration that was spent in the index.

name: IQueryResults.phrasesToHighlight
comment: Phrases to highlight (with stemming) in the results

name: IQueryResults.pipeline
comment: The pipeline that was used for this query.

name: IQueryResults.proxyDuration
comment: The duration of the query on the proxy (not always applicable, can be optional)

name: IQueryResults.queryCorrections
comment: Possible query corrections (eg : DidYouMean)

name: IQueryResults.rankingExpressions
comment:
A list of ranking expression that were used to tweak the relevance.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQueryResults.refinedKeywords
comment: The keywords selected by Coveo Machine Learning Refined Query feature

name: IQueryResults.results
comment: The results of the query

name: IQueryResults.searchAPIDuration
comment: The part of the total query duration that was spent in the Coveo Search API.

name: IQueryResults.searchUid
comment: A unique identifier for this query, used mainly for the Analytics service.

name: IQueryResults.splitTestRun
comment: The split test run that was used for this query. (A/B tests feature of the Coveo Query Pipeline)

name: IQueryResults.termsToHighlight
comment: Terms to highlight (with stemming) in the results

name: IQueryResults.totalCount
comment: The total number of results that matched the query in the index.

name: IQueryResults.totalCountFiltered
comment: The total number of results that matched the query in the index, but with the duplicate filtered.

name: IQueryResults.triggers
comment: The Coveo Query Pipeline triggers, if any were configured.

name: IQueryResults.userIdentities
comment:
A list of user identities that were used to perform this query.
Only sent if IQuery.debug is true

name: IQuerySuccessEventArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QueryEvents.querySuccess

name: IQuerySuccessEventArgs.query
comment: The query that was just executed

name: IQuerySuccessEventArgs.queryBuilder
comment: The QueryBuilder that was used for the current query

name: IQuerySuccessEventArgs.results
comment: The results returned by the query that was executed

name: IQuerySuccessEventArgs.searchAsYouType
comment: Whether the query is a search-as-you-type

name: IQuerySuggestCompletion
comment: The IQuerySuggestCompletion interface describes a completion suggestion from the Coveo Machine Learning service (see Coveo Machine Learning.

name: IQuerySuggestCompletion.executableConfidence
comment: Contains a value indicating the confidence level that this suggestion should be executed.

name: IQuerySuggestCompletion.expression
comment: Contains the expression to complete.

name: IQuerySuggestCompletion.highlighted
comment: Contains the highlighted expression to complete.

name: IQuerySuggestCompletion.score
comment: Contains a value indicating how certain the Coveo Machine Learning service is that this suggestion is actually relevant.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest
comment: The IQuerySuggestRequest interface describes a request to the Coveo Machine Learning service query suggest.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.actionsHistory
comment: Specfies the actions history which represents the past actions a user made. It is generated by the page view script (https://github.com/coveo/coveo.analytics.js)

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.context
comment: Specifies the context to use for the request.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.count
comment: Specifies the number of suggestions that the Coveo Machine Learning service should return. Default value is 5.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.enableWordCompletion
comment: Specifies whether to attempt to complete the last word of the current "q" parameter and boost the ranking score of the resulting expression so that it is returned as the first query suggestion.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.isGuestUser
comment: Whether the current user is anonymous. This can be specified when configuring the SearchEndpoint.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.locale
comment: The locale of the current user. Will typically match the "language" parameter that is used to perform standard queries.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.pipeline
comment: Specifies the pipeline to use for the request.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.q
comment: Specifies the query / word for which to get completion.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.referrer
comment: Specifies the third level of origin of the request, typically the URL of the page that linked to the search interface from which the request originates (e.g., in JavaScript, this would correspond to the document.referrer value).

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.searchHub
comment: Specifies the search hub for which to get suggestions.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.tab
comment: Specifies the second level of origin of the request, typically the identifier of the selected tab from which the request originates.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.timezone
comment: The tz database identifier of the time zone to use to correctly interpret dates in the query expression and result items.

name: IQuerySuggestRequest.visitorId
comment: A GUID representing the current user, who can be authenticated or anonymous. This GUID is normally generated by the usage analytics service and stored in a non-expiring browser cookie.

name: IQuerySuggestResponse
comment: The IQuerySuggestResponse interface describes a response from the Coveo Machine Learning service query suggestions.

name: IQuerySuggestResponse.completions
comment: Contains an array of completions.

name: IQuerySuggestSelection
comment: Describes the object that all querySuggestGetFocus and querySuggestSelection event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IQuerySuggestSelection.suggestion
comment: The query suggestion that had focus or was selected.

name: IQuerySummaryCancelLastActionArgs
comment: Argument sent to all handlers bound on QuerySummaryEvents.cancelLastAction

name: IQuickviewLoadedEventArgs
comment: The IQuickviewLoadedEventArgs interface describes the object that all quickviewLoaded event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IQuickviewLoadedEventArgs.duration
comment: The amount of time it took to download the content to display in the quickview modal window (in milliseconds).

name: IRangeValue
comment: Describes a single range value in a group by request or facet request.

name: IRangeValue.end
comment:
The value to end the range at. Examples:

  • 500
  • 2018-12-31T23:59:59.999Z

name: IRangeValue.endInclusive
comment: Whether to include the end value in the range.

name: IRangeValue.label
comment:
The label to associate with the range value. Examples:

  • 0 - 500
  • In 2018

name: IRangeValue.start
comment:
The value to start the range at. Examples:

  • 0
  • 2018-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

name: IRankingExpression
comment: Describe a ranking expression performed against the index (qre)

name: IRankingExpression.expression
comment: The expression that was executed in the ranking expression

name: IRankingExpression.modifier
comment: The relevance modifier that was applied

name: IRankingFunction
comment:
Describe a ranking function that can be executed against the index.
See: Ranking Functions

name: IRankingFunction.expression
comment: The mathematical expression that calculates the ranking value to add to the result score.

name: IRankingFunction.normalizeWeight
comment: Whether to normalize the value using the standard index scale or not. If you don't want to completely override the index ranking and use the qrf as a boost, you should turn this on.

name: IRatingRequest
comment: The IRatingRequest interface describes a request to rate an item in the index.

name: IRatingRequest.rating
comment: Contains the rating description. Possible values are Undefined | Lowest | Low | Average | Good | Best.

name: IRatingRequest.uniqueId
comment: Contains the unique ID of the item to rate.

name: IRequestInfo
comment: Information about a request

name: IRequestInfo.begun
comment: The timestamp at which the request started

name: IRequestInfo.headers
comment: The headers for the request.

name: IRequestInfo.method
comment: The method that was used for this request

name: IRequestInfo.queryString
comment: The query string parameters that were used for this request

name: IRequestInfo.requestData
comment: The data that was sent for this request

name: IRequestInfo.requestDataType
comment: The requestDataType that was used for this request

name: IRequestInfo.url
comment: Url that was requested

name: IResolvingPositionEventArgs
comment: The IResolvingPositionEventArgs interface describes the object that all onResolvingPosition event handlers receive as an argument.

name: IResolvingPositionEventArgs.providers
comment: The array of providers that can provide a position. The first provider that can resolve the position will be used.

name: IResponse
comment: A generic response

name: IResponse.data
comment: Data of the response

name: IResultsComponentBindings
comment: The bindings, or environment in which each component inside the ResultList exists.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.componentOptionsModel
comment: Contains the state of options for different components. Mainly used by ResultLink.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.componentStateModel
comment: Contains the state of different components (enabled vs disabled). Allows to get/set values. Triggers component state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.queryController
comment: Contains the singleton that allows to trigger queries.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.queryStateModel
comment: Contains the state of the query. Allows to get/set values. Triggers state event when modified. Each component can listen to those events.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.root
comment: The root HTMLElement of the SearchInterface in which the component exists.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.searchInterface
comment: A reference to the root of every component, the SearchInterface.

name: IResultsComponentBindings.usageAnalytics
comment: A reference to the Analytics.client.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions
comment: The possible options when creating a SearchEndpoint

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.accessToken
comment: This allows using an OAuth2 or a search token to authenticate against the Search API.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.anonymous
comment:
Specifies that the request (and the Coveo Search API) does not need any kind of authentication.
This flag is only needed for specific setups when your requests are being blocked by your browser. If your queries are executing correctly, you do not need to bother.
Setting this flag will prevent the withCredentials option to be set on the XMLHttpRequest, allowing performing cross-domain requests on a server that returns * in the Access-Control-Allow-Origin HTTP header.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.password
comment:
This is the password part of the credentials used to authenticate with the REST API.
This option should only be used for development purposes. Including secret credentials in an HTML page that is sent to a client browser is not secure.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.queryStringArguments
comment:
Query string arguments to add to every request to the search endpoint.
eg : {'foo':'bar', 'a':'b'}

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.renewAccessToken
comment:
Specifies a function that, when called, will arrange for a new search token to be generated.
It is expected to return a Promise that should be resolved with the new token once it's available.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.requestModifier
comment: A function which will allow external code to modify all endpoint call parameters before they are sent by the browser. Used in very specific scenario where the network infrastructure require special request headers to be added or removed, for example.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.restUri
comment: The uri for the search endpoint. eg: cloudplatform.coveo.com/rest/search

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.searchAlertsUri
comment: The uri for the Coveo search alerts service. If not specified, will automatically resolve using the restUri otherwise

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.username
comment:
This is the username part of the credentials used to authenticate with the Search API using Basic Authentication.
This option should only be used for development purposes. Including secret credentials in an HTML page that is sent to a client browser is not secure.

name: ISearchEndpointOptions.xmlHttpRequest
comment: The XmlHttpRequest implementation to use instead of the native one. If not specified, the native one is used.

name: ISearchEvent
comment: Describes a Coveo Cloud usage analytics search event.

name: ISearchEvent.actionCause
comment:
A unique name describing the action that triggered the event. See the name property of the IAnalyticsActionCause interface.

Example: pagerNext

name: ISearchEvent.actionType
comment:
A name describing the category of actions to which the action that triggered the event belongs. See the type property of the IAnalyticsActionCause interface.

Example: getMoreResults

name: ISearchEvent.advancedQuery
comment: The original advanced query expression (i.e., aq) sent for the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

name: ISearchEvent.anonymous
comment: Whether the event should be logged anonymously to the Coveo Cloud usage analytics service. Note: This field is normally set to the anonymous option value of the Analytics component.

name: ISearchEvent.clientId
comment: A GUID representing the current user. This GUID is generated locally and stored in a non-expiring browser cookie.

name: ISearchEvent.contextual
comment: Whether the related query was contextual. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

name: ISearchEvent.customData
comment:
Additional metadata to send along with the event. Note: This field may include custom user context information (see Sending Custom Context Information).

Example: { "currentResultsPerPage": 25, "userRole": "developer" }

name: ISearchEvent.device
comment:
The name of the device or browser that triggered the event. Note: The framework normally sets this field by parsing the current navigator.userAgent value.

Example: Chrome

name: ISearchEvent.didYouMean
comment:
Whether the did you mean feature was enabled for the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

Example: @source=="Product Documentation"

name: ISearchEvent.facetState
comment: A representation of the state of each dynamic facet in the search interface when the action that triggered the event was executed.

name: ISearchEvent.language
comment:
The language of the search interface from which the event originates. Must be a valid ISO-639-1 code.

Note: By default, the framework sets this field according to the currently loaded culture file (see Changing the Language of Your Search Interface).

Example: en

name: ISearchEvent.mobile
comment: Whether the event originates from a mobile device. Note: The framework normally sets this field by parsing the current navigator.userAgent value.

name: ISearchEvent.numberOfResults
comment: The number of query result items returned by the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related Search API query response.

name: ISearchEvent.originContext
comment:
The broad application context from which the event originates. Note: By default, the framework sets this field to Search. However, you can use the setOriginContext method of the Analytics component to modify the default value.

Example: Search

name: ISearchEvent.originLevel1
comment:
The identifier of the search interface from which the event originates. Note: This field is normally set through the searchHub option of the Analytics component. However, when actually recording the event, the Coveo Cloud usage analytics service may override this value with information extracted from the search token.

Example: PartnerPortalSearch

name: ISearchEvent.originLevel2
comment:
The identifier of the tab from which the event originates. Note: The framework normally sets this field to the identifier of the currently selected Tab in the search interface.

Example: All

name: ISearchEvent.originLevel3
comment:
The address of the webpage that linked to the search interface from which the event originates. Note: The framework normally sets this field to the current document.referrer value.

Example: http://example.com/

name: ISearchEvent.pageNumber
comment: The 0-based page of results requested for the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

name: ISearchEvent.queryPipeline
comment:
The name of the query pipeline to which the related query was routed. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related Search API query response.

Example: PartnerPortalSearchPipeline

name: ISearchEvent.queryText
comment:
The original basic query expression (i.e., q) sent for the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

Example: coveo machine learning

name: ISearchEvent.responseTime
comment: The time it took to get a response from the Search API for the query related to the event (in milliseconds). Note: The framework normally sets this field to 0, except for search events in which case it sets the field by retrieving the information from the related Search API query response.

name: ISearchEvent.resultsPerPage
comment: The number of results per page requested for the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related query.

name: ISearchEvent.searchQueryUid
comment:
The unique identifier of the related query. Note: The framework normally sets this field by retrieving the information from the related Search API query response.

Example: 74682726-0e20-46eb-85ac-f37259346f57

name: ISearchEvent.splitTestRunName
comment:
The name of the A/B test that applied to the related query. Note: This field may be set through the splitTestRunName option of the Analytics component. However, if the option is left undefined, the framework attempts to set this field by retrieving information from the related Search API query response.

Example: Test new ART model

name: ISearchEvent.splitTestRunVersion
comment:
The version of the A/B test that applied to the related query (i.e., version A or version B). Note: This field may be set through the splitTestRunVersion option of the Analytics component. However, if the option is left undefined and the related Search API query response indicates that an A/B test was applied, the framework sets this field to the name of the query pipeline to which the query was routed.

Example: PartnerPortalSearchPipelineWithART

name: ISearchEvent.userAgent
comment:
The software acting on behalf of the end-user whose action triggered the event. Note: By default, the framework sets this field to the current navigator.userAgent value.

Example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.100 Safari/537.36

name: ISearchEvent.userDisplayName
comment:
The display name of the end-user whose action triggered the event. Note: This field is normally set to the userDisplayName option value of the Analytics component. However, when actually recording the event, the Coveo Cloud usage analytics service may override this value with information extracted from the search token.

Example: Alice Smith

name: ISearchEvent.userGroups
comment: The groups the end-user whose action triggered the event belongs to. Note: This field is normally left undefined, and the Coveo Cloud usage analytics service attempts to extract the information from the search token when actually recording the event.

name: ISearchEvent.username
comment:
The identifier of the end-user whose action triggered the event. Note: This field is normally set to the user option value of the Analytics component. However, when actually recording the event, the Coveo Cloud usage analytics service may override this value with information extracted from the search token.

Example: asmith@example.com

name: ISizeOptions
comment: Available options for the size templateHelpers. Example:

name: ISizeOptions.base
comment:
The base into which to format the value. Formula: value * 10^(3 * base)

Examples:

Base 0:

1 => 1B

1000 => 1KB

Base 1:

1 => 1KB

1000 => 1MB

name: ISizeOptions.precision
comment:
The precision to use to format the size (i.e., the number of digits to display after the decimal) Examples:

Precision 0:

1.0 => 1

1.85 => 1

Precision 1:

1.0 => 1.0

1.85 => 1.8

name: IStreamHighlightOptions
comment: The possible options when highlighting a stream.

name: IStreamHighlightOptions.cssClass
comment: The css class that the highlight will generate. Defaults to coveo-highlight.

name: IStreamHighlightOptions.regexFlags
comment: The regex flags that should be applied to generate the highlighting. Defaults to gi.

name: IStringMap
comment:
A JSON which contains type T. eg :

IStringMap<boolean> -> {'foo' : true, 'bar' : false};
IStringMap<number> -> {'foo' : 1 , 'bar' : 123}

name: ISubscription
comment: Describe a subscription to the Coveo Search alerts service

name: ISubscription.frequency
comment: Frequency of the alerts

name: ISubscription.id
comment: The id of the subscription

name: ISubscription.name
comment: The name that should be used by the API to identify this subscription

name: ISubscription.type
comment:
Type of subscription.
Can be 'followQuery' or 'followDocument'

name: ISubscription.typeConfig
comment: Config of the subscription

name: ISubscription.user
comment: The user associated with the subscription

name: ISubscriptionItemRequest
comment: The ISubscriptionItemRequest interface describes a subscription to a single item (a result).

name: ISubscriptionItemRequest.id
comment: Contains the unique ID of the item to subscribe to.

name: ISubscriptionItemRequest.modifiedDateField
comment: Indicates which field contains the modification date of the item to subscribe to.

name: ISubscriptionItemRequest.title
comment: Contains the title of the item to subscribe to.

name: ISubscriptionItemRequest.watchedFields
comment: Contains a list of fields to monitor for the item to subscribe to.

name: ISubscriptionQueryRequest
comment: Describe a subscription to a single query

name: ISubscriptionQueryRequest.modifiedDateField
comment: Which field on the result set represent the modification date for which you wish to receive alerts

name: ISubscriptionQueryRequest.query
comment: Query to subscribe to

name: ISubscriptionRequest
comment: Describe a request to subscribe to the Coveo Search alerts service

name: ISubscriptionRequest.frequency
comment: Frequency of the alerts

name: ISubscriptionRequest.name
comment: The name that should be used by the API to identify this subscription

name: ISubscriptionRequest.type
comment:
Type of subscription.
Can be 'followQuery' or 'followDocument'

name: ISubscriptionRequest.typeConfig
comment: Config of the subscription

name: ISubscriptionUser
comment: Describe a user associated with a subscription to the Coveo Search alerts service

name: ISubscriptionUser.email
comment: The email of the user

name: ISubscriptionUser.manageToken
comment: The token used to manage the alerts via email.

name: ISuccessResponse
comment: A generic success response

name: ISuccessResponse.data
comment: Data of the response

name: ISuccessResponse.duration
comment: The time that the successfull response took to complete

name: ITaggingRequest
comment: The ITaggingRequest interface describes a tag request on an item.

name: ITaggingRequest.doAdd
comment: Indicates whether to add the tag value, or to remove the tag value.

name: ITaggingRequest.fieldName
comment: Contains the field name to tag.

name: ITaggingRequest.fieldValue
comment: Contains the value to tag.

name: ITaggingRequest.uniqueId
comment: Contains the unique ID of the item to tag.

name: ITemplateHelperFunction
comment: A function that describe a templates. It can take any number of arguments, but needs to return a simple string.

name: ITimeSpanUtilsOptions
comment: The possible options to use when calculating a timespan

name: ITimeSpanUtilsOptions.isMilliseconds
comment: Specify if the given timespan is in seconds or milliseconds

name: ITopQueries
comment: Describe a request to get top queries

name: ITopQueries.pageSize
comment: Determine how many suggestions to receive

name: ITopQueries.queryText
comment: The query text for which to receive suggestions

name: ITrigger
comment:
A trigger is an action that the interface will perform (show a message, execute a function, redirect users) depending on the query that was performed.
A trigger that can be configured in the Coveo Query Pipeline.

name: ITriggerExecute
comment: Execute a javascript function present in the page.

name: ITriggerNotify
comment: Notify (show a message) to a user

name: ITriggerQuery
comment: Perform a new query with a different query expression

name: ITriggerRedirect
comment: Redirect the user to another url

name: IUpdateResultPreviewsManagerOptionsEventArgs
comment: Executed when a Suggestion is focused before PopulateSearchResultPreviews is called to fetch more options.

name: IUpdateResultPreviewsManagerOptionsEventArgs.displayAfterDuration
comment: How many milliseconds should a Suggestion be focused for before PopulateSearchResultPreviews is called. If this is not defined, it will default to 200ms.

name: IUserActionsRequest
comment: The information about the user we'd like to check and its actions.

name: IUserActionsRequest.tagViewsOfUser
comment: The id of the user for which we should check the document views.

name: IUserIdentity
comment: Describe the identity of a user on the Coveo platform

name: IUserIdentity.name
comment: The name of the identity

name: IUserIdentity.provider
comment: The provider of the identity in the Coveo platform

name: IViewAsHtmlOptions
comment: The IViewAsHtmlOptions interface describes the available options when calling against a SearchEndpoint to view an item as an HTMLElement (think: quickview).

name: BaseFormTypes
comment: The basic types of form available to build an advanced search section.

name: Context
comment: A context, as returned by SearchInterface.getQueryContext or PipelineContext.getContext

name: IQueryExpression
comment: The IQueryExpression type is a string type dedicated to query expressions. This type is used to build a specific option for query expressions.

name: ResponseFormat
comment: The format of a successful response.

name: ValidLayout
comment: The possible valid and supported layouts. See the Result Layouts documentation.

name: ValidTooltipPlacement
comment: The allowed Quickview tooltipPlacement option values. The -start and -end variations indicate relative alignement. Horizontally (top, bottom), -start means left and -end means right. Vertically (left, right), -start means top and -end means bottom. No variation means center.

name: ResponsiveFacetOptions
comment: ResponsiveFacets options

name: ResponsiveFacetOptions.dropdownHeaderLabel
comment:
If the enableResponsiveMode option is true for all facets and FacetSlider.options.enableResponsiveMode is also true for all sliders, specifies the label of the dropdown button that allows to display the facets when in responsive mode. If more than one Facet or FacetSlider component in the search interface specifies a value for this option, the framework uses the first occurrence of the option.

Default value is Filters.

name: ResponsiveFacetOptions.enableResponsiveMode
comment:
Specifies whether to enable responsive mode for facets. Setting this options to false on any Facet, or FacetSlider component in a search interface disables responsive mode for all other facets in the search interface. Responsive mode displays all facets under a single dropdown button whenever the width of the HTML element which the search interface is bound to reaches or falls behind a certain threshold (see SearchInterface.responsiveComponents).

See also the dropdownHeaderLabel option.

Default value is true.
